entry.name: Energy Window Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe the energy window groups used. The number of items shall be equal to Number of Energy Windows (0054,0011). The first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the Energy Window Vector (0054,0010), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >Energy Window Name
entry.description: A user defined name which describes this Energy Window.

entry.name: >Energy Window Range Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describes this energy window group.

entry.name: >>Energy Window Lower Limit
entry.description: The lower limit of the energy window in KeV. See C.8.4.10.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >>Energy Window Upper Limit
entry.description: The upper limit of the energy window in KeV. See C.8.4.10.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Radiopharmaceutical Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe isotope information. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 18.

entry.name: >Radionuclide Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the radionuclide. This sequence shall contain exactly one item. Required if a sequence Item is present. The Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102) shall have an Enumerated Value of "99SDM" for historical reasons. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Route
entry.description: Route of injection.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 11.

entry.name: >Administration Route Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the administration route for the radiopharmaceutical. This sequence shall contain exactly one item.

entry.name: Detector Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe the detectors used. The number of items shall be equal to Number of Detectors (0054,0021). The first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the Detector Vector (0054,0020), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >Collimator/Grid Name
entry.description: Label describing the collimator used (LEAP, hires, etc.)

entry.name: >Collimator Type
entry.description: Collimator type. Defined Terms: PARA = Parallel (default) PINH = Pinhole FANB = Fan-beam CONE = Cone-beam SLNT = Slant hole ASTG = Astigmatic DIVG = Diverging NONE = No collimator UNKN = Unknown Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Field of View Shape
entry.description: Shape of the field of view of the Nuclear Medicine detector. Defined Terms: RECTANGLE ROUND HEXAGONAL

entry.name: >Field of View Dimension(s)
entry.description: Dimensions of the field of view, in mm. If Field of View Shape (0018,1147) is: RECTANGLE: row dimension followed by column. ROUND: diameter. HEXAGONAL: diameter of a circumscribed circle.

entry.name: >Focal Distance
entry.description: Focal distance, in mm. A value of 0 means infinite distance for parallel collimation. See C.8.4.11.1.1 for further specialization. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >X Focus Center
entry.description: Center of focus along a row. See C.8.4.11.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Y Focus Center
entry.description: Center of focus along a column. See C.8.4.11.1.2 for further explanation. Page 405

entry.name: >Zoom Center
entry.description: The amount of offset from (0,0) applied to each pixel in the image before application of the zoom factor, specified by a numeric pair: row value (delimiter) column value (in mm). See C.8.4.11.1.3 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Zoom Factor
entry.description: The amount of magnification applied to each pixel in the image, specified by a numeric pair: row value (delimiter) column value. See C.8.4.11.1.4 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Center of Rotation Offset
entry.description: Average center of rotation offset of Nuclear Medicine detector in mm. See C.8.4.11.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Gantry/Detector Tilt
entry.description: Angle of tilt in degrees of the detector. See C.8.4.11.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance in mm from transmission source to the detector face. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 4 is TRANSMISSION, Value 3 is not TOMO, and a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Start Angle
entry.description: Position of the detector about the patient for the start of the acquisition, in degrees. Zero degrees is referenced to the origin at the patient's back. Viewing from the patient's feet, angle increases in a counter- clockwise direction (detector normal rotating from the patient's back towards the patient's left side). Should not be included if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, is TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

entry.name: > Radial Position
entry.description: Radial distance of the detector from the center of rotation, in mm. Should not be included if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, is TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

entry.name: >Image Orientation (Patient)
entry.description: The direction cosines of the first row and the first column with respect to the patient. See C.7.6.2.1.1 for further explanation. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Image Position (Patient)
entry.description: The x, y, and z coordinates of the upper left hand corner (center of the first voxel transmitted) of the image, in mm. See C.7.6.2.1.1 for further explanation. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: Rotation Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe TOMO rotational groups. A new rotation is defined whenever the direction of the detector motion changes, or the Table Traverse (0018,1131) changes. The number of items shall be equal to Number of Rotations (0054,0051). If Rotation Vector (0054,0050) is present, the first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the Rotation Vector (0054,0050), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >Start Angle
entry.description: Position of the detector about the patient for the start of this rotation, in degrees. Zero degrees is referenced to the origin at the patient's back. Viewing from the patient's feet, angle increases in a counter- clockwise direction (detector normal rotating from the patient's back towards the patient's left side). Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Angular Step
entry.description: The angular scan arc step between views of the TOMO acquisition, in degrees. See C.8.4.12.1.1 for further explanation. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Rotation Direction
entry.description: Direction of rotation of the detector about the patient. See Start Angle (0054,0200) for further explanation of direction. Enumerated Values:

entry.name: Beat Rejection Flag
entry.description: Heart beat duration sorting has been applied. Enumerated Values: Y = yes N = no

entry.name: PVC Rejection
entry.description: Description of type of arrhythmic beat rejection criteria used.

entry.name: Skip Beats
entry.description: Number of beats skipped after a detected arrhythmia

entry.name: Heart Rate
entry.description: Average number of heart beats per minute for the collection period for these frames. This shall include all accepted beats as well as rejected beats.

entry.name: Gated Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe R-R intervals. Each gated interval is defined by an upper and lower range of heart beat durations. Required if the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) contains the Tag for R-R Interval Vector (0054,0060). The number of items shall be equal to Number of R-R Intervals (0054,0061). The first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the R-R Interval Vector (0054,0060), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >Trigger Time
entry.description: Time interval measured in msec from the start of the R-wave to the beginning of the data taking.

entry.name: >Framing Type
entry.description: Description of type of framing performed such as forward, backward, forward/backward by percentage.

entry.name: >Data Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe gating criteria. See C.8.4.13.1.1. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >>Frame Time
entry.description: Nominal time per individual frame in msec. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >>Nominal Interval
entry.description: Average duration of accepted beats, in msec.

entry.name: >>Low R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval lower limit for beat rejection, in msec

entry.name: >>High R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval upper limit for beat rejection, in msec

entry.name: Phase Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describes each dynamic phase. Required if the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) contains the Tag for Phase Vector (0054,0030). The number of items shall be equal to Number of Phases (0054,0031). The first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the Phase Vector (0054,0030), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >Phase Delay
entry.description: Time paused between the last frame of the previous phase and the first frame of this phase, in msec. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Actual Frame Duration
entry.description: Nominal time of acquisition per individual frame, in msec. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Pause Between Frames
entry.description: Time paused between each frame of this phase (in msec). Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Number of Frames in Phase
entry.description: Number of frames in this phase. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Trigger Vector
entry.description: An array of trigger times when gating information is acquired simultaneously with the dynamic image data. See Section C.8.4.14.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Number of Triggers in Phase
entry.description: The number of entries in the Trigger Vector (0054,0210) for this phase. Required if Trigger Vector (0054,0210) is present.

entry.name: >Phase Description
entry.description: Description of this phase of the Dynamic image. Defined Terms: FLOW WASHOUT UPTAKE EMPTYING EXCRETION

entry.name: Spacing Between Slices
entry.description: Spacing between slices, in mm, measured from center-to-center of each slice along the normal to the first image. The sign of the Spacing Between Slices (0018,0088) determines the direction of stacking. The normal is determined by the cross product of the direction cosines of the first row and first column of the first frame, such that a positive spacing indicates slices are stacked behind the first slice and a negative spacing indicates slices are stacked in front of the first slice. See Image Orientation (0020,0037) in the NM Detector module.

entry.name: Reconstruction Diameter
entry.description: Diameter, in mm, of the region from within which the data was used in creating the reconstruction of the image. Data may exist outside this region and portions of the patient may exist outside this region.

entry.name: Convolution Kernel
entry.description: A label describing the convolution kernel or algorithm used to reconstruct the data.

entry.name: Slice Thickness
entry.description: Nominal slice thickness, in mm.

entry.name: Slice Location
entry.description: Relative position of exposure expressed in mm. See C.7.6.2.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Slice Progression Direction
entry.description: Describes the anatomical direction that slices are progressing as the slices are considered in order (as defined by the Slice Vector (0054,0080)). Meaningful only for cardiac images. When View Code Sequence (0054,0220) indicates a short axis view, then Enumerated Values are: APEX_TO_BASE BASE_TO_APEX Page 413

entry.name: Sequence of Ultrasound Regions
entry.description: Defines a sequence of Ultrasound Regions. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Region Location Min x0
entry.description: The bounds of a rectangle specifying the location of the region, x0,y0,x1,y1. See C.8.5.5.1.14 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Region Location Min y0
entry.description: The bounds of a rectangle specifying the location of the region, x0,y0,x1,y1. See C.8.5.5.1.14 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Region Location Max x1
entry.description: The bounds of a rectangle specifying the location of the region, x0,y0,x1,y1. See C.8.5.5.1.14 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Region Location Max y1
entry.description: The bounds of a rectangle specifying the location of the region, x0,y0,x1,y1.

entry.name: Samples Per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (planes) in this image. See C.8.5.6.1.12 for specialization

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. See C.8.5.6.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. See C.8.5.6.1.13 for specialization.

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. See C.8.5.6.1.14 for specialization.

entry.name: High Bit
entry.description: Most significant bit for pixel sample data. See C.8.5.6.1.15 for specialization.

entry.name: Planar Configuration
entry.description: Indicates whether the pixel data are sent color-by-plane or color-by-pixel. Required if Samples per Pixel (0028,0002) has a value greater than 1. See C.8.5.6.1.16 for specialization. Page 433

entry.name: Pixel Representation
entry.description: Data representation of pixel samples. See C.8.5.6.1.3 for specialization.

entry.name: Frame Increment Pointer
entry.description: Contains the Data Element Tag of the attribute which is used as the frame increment in Multi-frame pixel data (see C.7.6.6). Required if Number of Frames is sent. See C.8.5.6.1.4 for specialization.

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics. See C.8.5.6.1.1 for specialization.

entry.name: Lossy Image Compression
entry.description: Specifies whether an Image has undergone lossy compression. Enumerated Values: 00 = Image has NOT been subjected to lossy compression. 01 = Image has been subjected to lossy compression. See C.7.6.1.1.5 Required if Lossy Compression has been performed on the Image.

entry.name: Number of Stages
entry.description: Number of Stages in this protocol. Required if image was acquired in a Staged protocol.

entry.name: Number of Views in Stage
entry.description: Number of views in this Stage. Required if image was acquired in a Staged protocol.

entry.name: R Wave Time Vector
entry.description: The time offset(s) of the reported R Wave peaks, each relative to the time of the start of the acquisition of the first frame in msec. Multi-valued, with one value per reported R Wave.

entry.name: Ultrasound Color Data Present
entry.description: This element indicates if any ultrasound color data is present in an image. Enumerated Values: 00 = Ultrasound color data not present in image 01 = Ultrasound color data is present in image. See C.8.5.6.10

entry.name: Stage Name
entry.description: A Stage is a particular time slice of a protocol in which a set of images are collected. The names can be free form text. Recommended text for Stress Echo stage names are: PRE-EXERCISE, POST-EXERCISE, PEAK-EXERCISE, RECOVERY, BASELINE,

entry.name: Conversion Type
entry.description: Describes the kind of image conversion. Defined Terms : DV = Digitized Video DI = Digital Interface DF = Digitized Film WSD = Workstation SD = Scanned Document SI = Scanned Image DRW = Drawing SYN = Synthetic Image

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Source equipment for the image. This type definition shall override the definition in the General Series Module. See C.7.3.1.1.1 for Defined Terms.

entry.name: Secondary Capture Device ID
entry.description: User defined identification of the device that converted the image

entry.name: Secondary Capture Device Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of the Secondary Capture Device

entry.name: Secondary Capture Device Manufacturer's Model Name
entry.description: Manufacturer's model number of the Secondary Capture Device

entry.name: Secondary Capture Device Software Version
entry.description: Manufacturer's designation of software version of the Secondary Capture Device

entry.name: Video Image Format Acquired
entry.description: Original format of the captured video image (e.g. NTSC, PAL, Videomed-H)

entry.name: Digital Image Format Acquired
entry.description: Additional information about digital interface used to acquire the image

entry.name: Date of Secondary Capture
entry.description: The date the Secondary Capture Image was captured.

entry.name: Time of Secondary Capture
entry.description: The time the Secondary Capture Image was captured.

include.ref: Include Basic Pixel Spacing Calibration Macro (Table 10-10)

entry.name: Nominal Scanned Pixel Spacing
entry.description: Physical distance on the media being digitized or scanned between the center of each pixel, specified by a numeric pair - adjacent row spacing (delimiter) adjacent column spacing in mm. See 10.7.1.3 for further explanation of the value order. Shall be consistent with Pixel Aspect Ratio (0028,0034), if present.

entry.name: Burned In Annotation
entry.description: Indicates whether or not image contains sufficient burned in annotation to identify the patient and date the image was acquired. Page 445 Enumerated Values: YES NO

entry.name: Presentation LUT Shape
entry.description: Specifies an identity transformation for the Presentation LUT, such that the output of all grayscale transformations defined in the IOD containing this Module are defined to be P-Values. Enumerated Values: IDENTITY - output is in P-Values. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) is MONOCHROME2, and BitsStored (0028,0101) is greater than 1. Note: If the VOI LUT Module is required by the IOD but no VOI LUT Sequence (0028,3010) or Window Center (0028,1050) is present, then the VOI LUT stage is an identity transformation.

entry.name: Illumination
entry.description: Luminance of a hypothetical viewing device illuminating a piece of monochrome transmissive film, or for the case of reflective media, luminance obtainable from diffuse reflection of the illumination present. Expressed as L0, in candelas per square meter (cd/m2). Note: May be used together with Reflected Ambient Light (2010,0160) to recover Optical Density information from P-Values. See C.8.6.3.1.

entry.name: Reflected Ambient Light
entry.description: For scanned monochrome transmissive film viewed on a hypothetical viewing device, the luminance contribution due to reflected ambient light. Expressed as La, in candelas per square meter (cd/m2). Note: May be used together with Illumination (2010,015E) to recover Optical Density information from P- Values. See C.8.6.3.1.

entry.name: Rescale Intercept
entry.description: The value b in the relationship between stored values (SV) in Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) and the output units specified in Rescale Type (0028,1054). Output units = m*SV + b. Enumerated Value: 0 Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) is MONOCHROME2, and BitsStored () is greater than 1. Note: This specifies an identity Modality LUT transformation.

entry.name: Frame Time Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the real time increments (in msec) between frames for a Multi-frame image. See C.7.6.5.1.2 for further explanation. Required if Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) points to Frame Time Vector (0018,1065). Note: Frame Time Vector arrays may not be properly encoded if Explicit-VR transfer syntax is used and the VL of this attribute exceeds 65534 bytes.

entry.name: Page Number Vector
entry.description: An array which contains, for each of the image frames, the corresponding page numbers of the original document. Required if Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) points to Page Number Vector (0018,2001).

entry.name: Frame Label Vector
entry.description: An array which contains, for each of the image frames, a descriptive label. Required if Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) points to Frame Label Vector (0018,2002).

entry.name: Frame Primary Angle Vector
entry.description: An array which contains, for each of the image frames, the primary angle of rotation about an undefined axis, in degrees. May be used for annotative purposes for "cine loops" of 3D reprojected images

entry.name: Frame Increment Pointer
entry.description: Required if Multi-Frame Image. Contains the Data Element Tag of the attribute that is used as the Frame increment in Multi-frame image pixel data (See C.7.6.6). Specialized for X-Ray as Enumerated Value: 00181063H = Frame Time (0018,1063); 00181065H = Frame Time Vector (0018,1065).

entry.name: Lossy Image Compression
entry.description: Specifies whether an Image has undergone lossy compression. Enumerated Values: 00 = Image has NOT been subjected to lossy compression. 01 = Image has been subjected to lossy compression. See C.7.6.1.1.5 Required if Lossy Compression has been performed on the Image.

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics. See C.8.7.1.1.1 for specialization.

entry.name: Pixel Intensity Relationship
entry.description: The relationship between the Pixel sample values and the X-Ray beam intensity. See Section C.8.7.1.1.2.

entry.name: Samples per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (color planes) in this image shall have a value of 1.

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. Only MONOCHROME2 may be used.

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. See Section C.8.7.1.1.6.

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. See Section C.8.7.1.1.7.

entry.name: High Bit
entry.description: Most significant bit for pixel sample data. See Section C.8.7.1.1.8.

entry.name: KVP
entry.description: Peak kilo voltage output of the X-Ray generator used.

entry.name: Radiation Setting
entry.description: Identify the general level of X-Ray dose exposure. Enumerated values are: SC = low dose exposure generally corresponding to fluoroscopic settings (e.g. preparation for diagnostic quality image acquisition); GR = high dose for diagnostic quality image acquisition (also called digital spot or cine);

entry.name: X-Ray Tube Current
entry.description: X-Ray Tube Current in mA. Required if Exposure (0018,1152) is not present.

entry.name: X-Ray Tube Current in ?A
entry.description: X-Ray Tube Current in ?A.

entry.name: Collimator Shape
entry.description: Shape(s) of the collimator. Enumerated Values: RECTANGULAR CIRCULAR POLYGONAL This multi-valued Attribute shall contain at most one of each Enumerated Value.

entry.name: Collimator Left Vertical Edge
entry.description: Required if Collimator Shape (0018,1700) is RECTANGULAR. Location of the left edge of the rectangular collimator with respect to pixels in the image given as column. See C.8.7.3.1.1.

entry.name: Collimator Right Vertical Edge
entry.description: Required if Collimator Shape (0018,1700) is RECTANGULAR. Location of the right edge of the rectangular collimator with respect to pixels in the image given as column. See C.8.7.3.1.1.

entry.name: Collimator Upper Horizontal Edge
entry.description: Required if Collimator Shape (0018,1700) is RECTANGULAR. Location of the upper edge of the rectangular collimator with respect to pixels in the image given as row. See C.8.7.3.1.1.

entry.name: Collimator Lower Horizontal Edge
entry.description: Required if Collimator Shape (0018,1700) is RECTANGULAR. Location of the lower edge of the rectangular collimator with respect to pixels in the image given as row. See C.8.7.3.1.1.

entry.name: Center of Circular Collimator
entry.description: Required if Collimator Shape (0018,1700) is CIRCULAR. Location of the center of the circular collimator with respect to pixels in the image given as row and column. See C.8.7.3.1.1.

entry.name: Radius of Circular Collimator
entry.description: Required if Collimator Shape (0018,1700) is CIRCULAR. Radius of the circular collimator with respect to pixels in the image given as a number of pixels along the row direction. See C.8.7.3.1.1.

entry.name: Vertices of the Polygonal Collimator
entry.description: Required if Collimator Shape (0018,1700) is POLYGONAL. Multiple Values where the first set of two values are: row of the origin vertex; column of the origin vertex. Two or more pairs of values follow and are the row and column coordinates of the other vertices of the polygon collimator. Polygon collimators are implicitly closed Page 457 from the last vertex to the origin vertex and all edges shall be non-intersecting except at the vertices.

entry.name: Table Motion
entry.description: Defined terms: STATIC DYNAMIC

entry.name: Table Vertical Increment
entry.description: Incremental change in Vertical position of the table relative to first frame of Multi- frame image given in mm. Required if Table Motion is DYNAMIC.

entry.name: Table Longitudinal Increment
entry.description: Incremental change in Longitudinal position of the table relative to first frame of Multi-frame image in mm. Table motion towards +90?position of the primary angle of the positioner is positive. See C.8.7.4.1.2. Required if Table Motion is DYNAMIC.

entry.name: Table Lateral Increment
entry.description: Incremental change in Lateral position of the table relative to first frame of Multi- frame image given in mm. Table motion towards +90?position of the secondary angle of the positioner is positive. See C.8.7.4.1.3. Required if Table Motion is DYNAMIC.

entry.name: Table Angle
entry.description: Angle of table plane in degrees relative to

entry.name: Distance Source to Patient
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to isocenter (center of field of view). Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Object Distance (SOD).

entry.name: Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to detector center. Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Image Receptor Distance (SID).

entry.name: Estimated Radiographic Magnification Factor
entry.description: Ratio of Source Image Receptor Distance (SID) over Source Object Distance (SOD).

entry.name: Positioner Motion
entry.description: Used to describe the activity of the imaging devices. Defined terms: DYNAMIC, STATIC. Required if Multi-frame data. See C.8.7.5.1.1.

entry.name: Positioner Primary Angle
entry.description: Position of the X-Ray Image Intensifier Page 461 about the patient from the RAO to LAO direction where movement from RAO to vertical is positive. See C.8.7.5.1.2.

entry.name: Positioner Secondary Angle
entry.description: Position of the X-Ray Image Intensifier about the patient from the CAU to CRA direction where movement from CAU to vertical is positive. See C.8.7.5.1.2

entry.name: Positioner Primary Angle Increment
entry.description: Incremental change in primary positioner angle for each frame. See C.8.7.5.1.3. Required if Positioner Motion is DYNAMIC.

entry.name: Positioner Secondary Angle Increment
entry.description: Incremental change in secondary positioner angle for each frame. See C.8.7.5.1.3. Required if Positioner Motion is DYNAMIC.

entry.name: Detector Primary Angle
entry.description: Angle of the X-Ray beam in the row direction in degrees relative to the normal to the detector plane. Positive values indicate that the X-Ray beam is tilted towards higher numbered columns. Negative values indicate that the X-Ray beam is tilted towards lower numbered columns. See C.8.7.5.1.4.

entry.name: Detector Secondary Angle
entry.description: Angle of the X-Ray beam in the column direction in degrees relative to the normal to the detector plane. Positive values indicate that the X-Ray beam is tilted towards lower numbered rows. Negative values indicate that the X-Ray beam is tilted towards higher numbered rows. See C.8.7.5.1.4.

entry.name: Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to detector center. Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Image Receptor Distance (SID).

entry.name: Distance Source to Patient
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to isocenter (center of field of view). Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Object Distance (SOD).

entry.name: Estimated Radiographic Magnification Factor
entry.description: Ratio of SID (Source Image Receptor Distance) over SOD (Source Object Distance).

entry.name: Column Angulation
entry.description: Angle of the X-Ray beam in degree relative to an orthogonal axis to the detector plane. Positive values indicate that the tilt is towards the head of the table. Note: The detector plane is assumed to be parallel to the table plane.

entry.name: Tomo Layer Height
entry.description: Distance in mm between the table surface and the sharp image plane.

entry.name: Tomo Angle
entry.description: Angle span in degrees of rotation of X-Ray Source during X-Ray acquisition.

entry.name: Tomo Time
entry.description: Time in seconds the source has taken to rotate the Tomo Angle during X-Ray acquisition.

entry.name: Tomo Type
entry.description: Type of tomography. Defined Terms: LINEAR SPIRAL POLYCYCLOIDAL CIRCULAR Page 465

entry.name: Tomo Class
entry.description: Form of tomography: Defined Terms: MOTION TOMOSYNTHESIS

entry.name: Number of Tomosynthesis Source Images
entry.description: The number of source images used to construct this tomosynthetic image. Only meaningful if Tomo Class (0018,1491) is TOMOSYNTHESIS. These may be listed in Source Image Sequence (0008,2112) of the General Image Module.

entry.name: KVP
entry.description: Peak kilo voltage output of the X-Ray generator used.

entry.name: X-Ray Tube Current
entry.description: X-Ray Tube Current in mA.

entry.name: X-Ray Tube Current in ?A
entry.description: X-Ray Tube Current in ?A.

entry.name: Exposure Time
entry.description: Duration of X-Ray exposure in msec.

entry.name: Exposure Time in ?S
entry.description: Duration of X-Ray exposure in ?sec.

entry.name: Exposure
entry.description: The exposure expressed in mAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-ray Tube Current.

entry.name: Exposure in ?As
entry.description: The exposure expressed in ?As, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-ray Tube Current.

entry.name: Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to detector center. Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Image Receptor Distance (SID).

entry.name: Distance Source to Patient
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to the table, support or bucky side that is closest to the Imaging Subject, as measured along the central ray of the X-Ray beam. Note: 1. This definition is less useful in terms of estimating geometric magnification than a measurement to a defined point within the Imaging Subject, but accounts for what is realistically measurable in an automated fashion in a clinical setting. 2. This measurement does not take into account any air gap between the Imaging Subject and

entry.name: KVP
entry.description: Peak kilo voltage output of the X-Ray generator used.

entry.name: X-Ray Tube Current
entry.description: X-Ray Tube Current in mA.

entry.name: X-Ray Tube Current in ?A
entry.description: X-Ray Tube Current in ?A.

entry.name: Exposure Time
entry.description: Duration of X-Ray exposure in msec.

entry.name: Exposure Time in ?S
entry.description: Duration of X-Ray exposure in ?sec.

entry.name: Exposure
entry.description: The exposure expressed in mAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time Page 469 and X-ray Tube Current.

entry.name: Exposure in ?As
entry.description: The exposure expressed in ?As, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-ray Tube Current.

entry.name: Exposure Control Mode
entry.description: Type of exposure control. Defined Terms: MANUAL AUTOMATIC

entry.name: Exposure Control Mode Description
entry.description: Text description of the mechanism of exposure control. May describe the number and type of exposure sensors or position of the sensitive area of the imaging detector.

entry.name: Exposure Status
entry.description: Whether the exposure was normally completed or not. Defined Terms: NORMAL ABORTED

entry.name: Phototimer Setting
entry.description: Nominal percentage phototimer setting, where a more positive value indicates greater exposure and a more negative value indicates less exposure.

entry.name: Focal Spot
entry.description: Nominal focal spot size in mm used to acquire this image.

entry.name: Anode Target Material
entry.description: The primary material in the anode of the X- Ray source. Defined Terms: TUNGSTEN MOLYBDENUM RHODIUM

entry.name: Rectification Type
entry.description: Type of rectification used in the X-Ray generator. Defined Terms: SINGLE PHASE THREE PHASE CONST POTENTIAL

entry.name: Generator ID
entry.description: Identifier of the generator

entry.name: Filter Type
entry.description: Type of filter(s) inserted into the X-Ray beam (e.g. wedges).

entry.name: Grid
entry.description: Identifies the grid. May be multi-valued. Defined Terms are: FIXED FOCUSED RECIPROCATING PARALLEL CROSSED NONE

entry.name: Grid Absorbing Material
entry.description: The X-Ray absorbing material used in the grid.

entry.name: Grid Spacing Material
entry.description: The spacing material used in the grid.

entry.name: Grid Thickness
entry.description: The thickness in mm of the X-Ray absorbing material used in the grid.

entry.name: Grid Pitch
entry.description: The pitch in mm of the X-Ray absorbing material used in the grid. Page 471

entry.name: Grid Aspect Ratio
entry.description: Ratio of the vertical spacing and horizontal spacing of the X-Ray absorbing material used in the grid. Specified by a pair of integer values where the first value is the vertical size, and the second value is the horizontal size.

entry.name: Grid Period
entry.description: Period in mSec of reciprocation cycle. Only meaningful if Grid (0018,1166) is RECIPROCATING.

entry.name: Grid Focal Distance
entry.description: Focal distance in mm of a FOCUSED grid.

entry.name: Grid ID
entry.description: Identifier of the grid

table.ref: Table C.8-37 - RT SERIES MODULE ATTRIBUTES
table.name: Table C.8-37 - RT SERIES MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Type of equipment that originally acquired the data. Enumerated Values: RTIMAGE = RT Image RTDOSE = RT Dose RTSTRUCT = RT Structure Set RTPLAN = RT Plan RTRECORD = RT Treatment Record See C.8.8.1.1.

entry.name: Series Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of the series.

entry.name: Series Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this series.

entry.name: Series Description
entry.description: User provided description of the series.

entry.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance to which the Series is related (e.g. a Modality or General-Purpose Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance). One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence (0008,1111) is sent. Page 473

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence (0008,1111) is sent.

include.ref: >Include Request Attributes Macro Table 10-9 No Baseline Context IDs defined

entry.name: Request Attributes Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that contains attributes from the Imaging Service Request. The sequence may have one or more Items.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step ID
entry.description: User or equipment generated identifier of that part of a Procedure that has been carried out within this step.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Start Date
entry.description: Date on which the Performed Procedure Step started.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Start Time
entry.description: Time on which the Performed Procedure Step started.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Description
entry.description: Institution-generated description or classification of the Procedure Step that was performed.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Performed Protocol Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence describing the Protocol performed for this Procedure Step. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

include.ref: >>Include `Content Item Macro' Table 10-2 No Baseline Template is defined.

entry.name: >Protocol Context Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies the context for the Performed Protocol Code Sequence Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

include.ref: >>>Include `Content Item Macro' Table 10-2 No Baseline Template is defined.

entry.name: >> Content Item Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies modifiers for a Protocol Context Content Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence. See Section C.4.10.1.

entry.name: Samples per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (planes) in this image. See C.8.8.2.6.1 for specialization.

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. See C.8.8.2.6.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated. See C.8.8.2.6.3 for specialization.

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits stored. See C.8.8.2.6.4 for specialization.

entry.name: High Bit
entry.description: Most significant bit for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same high bit. See C.8.8.2.6.5 for specialization.

entry.name: Pixel Representation
entry.description: Data representation of the pixel samples. Each sample shall have the same pixel representation. See C.8.8.2.6.6 for specialization.

entry.name: Pixel Intensity Relationship
entry.description: The relationship between the Pixel sample values and the X-Ray beam intensity. Enumerated Values: LIN = Linearly proportional to X-Ray beam intensity Page 475 LOG = Logarithmically proportional to X- Ray beam intensity See C.8.11.3.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Pixel Intensity Relationship Sign
entry.description: The sign of the relationship between the Pixel sample values stored in Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) and the X-Ray beam intensity. Required if Pixel Intensity Relationship (0028,1040) is present. Enumerated Values; 1 = Lower pixel values correspond to less X-Ray beam intensity -1 = Higher pixel values correspond to less X-Ray beam intensity See C.8.11.3.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: RT Image Label
entry.description: User-defined label for RT Image.

entry.name: RT Image Name
entry.description: User-defined name for RT Image.

entry.name: RT Image Description
entry.description: User-defined description of RT Image.

entry.name: Operators' Name
entry.description: Name of operator(s) acquiring or creating RT Image.

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics (see Section C.7.6.1.1.2). RT Images shall use one of the following Defined Terms for Value 3: DRR = digitally reconstructed radiograph PORTAL = digital portal image or portal film image SIMULATOR = conventional simulator image RADIOGRAPH = radiographic image BLANK = image pixels set to background value FLUENCE = fluence map

entry.name: Conversion Type
entry.description: Describes the kind of image conversion. Defined Terms: DV = Digitized Video DI = Digital Interface DF = Digitized Film WSD = Workstation

entry.name: Reported Values Origin
entry.description: Describes the origin of the parameter values reported in the image. Required if Value 3 of Image Type (0008,0008) is SIMULATOR or PORTAL. Enumerated Values: OPERATOR = manually entered by operator

entry.name: Samples per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (planes) in this image. See C.8.8.3.4.1 for specialization. Required if Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) is present.

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. See C.8.8.3.4.2 for specialization. Required if Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) is present.

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated. See C.8.8.3.4.3 for specialization. Required Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) is present.

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits stored. See C.8.8.3.4.4 for specialization. Required if Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) is present.

entry.name: High Bit
entry.description: Most significant bit for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same high bit. See C.8.8.3.4.5 for specialization. Required if Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) is Page 485 present.

entry.name: Pixel Representation
entry.description: Data representation of the pixel samples. Each sample shall have the same pixel representation. See C.8.8.3.4.6 for specialization. Required Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) is present.

entry.name: Dose Units
entry.description: Units used to describe dose. Enumerated Values: GY = Gray RELATIVE = dose relative to implicit reference value

entry.name: Dose Type
entry.description: Type of dose. Defined Terms: PHYSICAL = physical dose EFFECTIVE = physical dose after correction for biological effect using user- defined modeling technique ERROR = difference between desired and planned dose

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this object instance.

entry.name: Dose Comment
entry.description: User-defined comments for dose data.

entry.name: Normalization Point
entry.description: Coordinates (x, y, z) of normalization point in the patient based coordinate system described in C.7.6.2.1.1 (mm). See C.8.8.3.1.

entry.name: Dose Summation Type
entry.description: Type of dose summation. Defined Terms: PLAN = dose calculated for entire RT Plan FRACTION = dose calculated for a single Fraction Group within RT Plan BEAM = dose calculated for one or more Beams within RT Plan BRACHY = dose calculated for one or more Brachy Application Setups within RT Plan CONTROL_POINT = dose calculated for one or more Control Points within a Beam

entry.name: Referenced RT Plan Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of one Class/Instance pair describing RT Plan associated with dose. Required if Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is PLAN, FRACTION, BEAM, BRACHY or CONTROL_POINT. Only a single item shall be permitted in this sequence. See Note 1.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if Referenced RT Plan

entry.name: Referenced Structure Set Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of one class/instance pair describing Structure Set containing structures which are used to calculate Dose-Volume Histograms (DVHs). Only a single item shall be permitted in this sequence. See C.8.8.4.1.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: DVH Normalization Point
entry.description: Coordinates (x, y, z) of common DVH normalization point in the patient based coordinate system described in C.7.6.2.1.1 (mm).

entry.name: DVH Normalization Dose Value
entry.description: Dose Value at DVH Normalization Point (3004,0040) used as reference for individual DVHs when Dose Units (3004,0002) is RELATIVE. Page 491

entry.name: DVH Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of DVHs. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >DVH Referenced ROI Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of referenced ROIs used to calculate DVH.

entry.name: >>Referenced ROI Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies ROI used to calculate DVH specified by ROI Number (3006,0022) in Structure Set ROI Sequence (3006,0020) in Structure Set Module within RT Structure Set referenced by referenced RT Plan in Referenced RT Plan Sequence (300C,0002) in RT Dose Module.

entry.name: >>DVH ROI Contribution Type
entry.description: Specifies whether volume within ROI is included or excluded in DVH. See C.8.8.4.2. Enumerated Values: INCLUDED, EXCLUDED.

entry.name: >DVH Type
entry.description: Type of DVH. Enumerated Values: DIFFERENTIAL = differential dose-volume histogram CUMULATIVE = cumulative dose-volume histogram NATURAL = natural dose volume histogram

entry.name: >Dose Units
entry.description: Dose axis units. Enumerated Values: GY = Gray RELATIVE = dose relative to reference value specified in DVH Normalization Dose Value (3004,0042)

entry.name: >Dose Type
entry.description: Type of dose. Defined Terms: PHYSICAL = physical dose EFFECTIVE = physical dose after correction for biological effect using user- defined modeling technique ERROR = difference between desired and planned dose

entry.name: >DVH Dose Scaling
entry.description: Scaling factor that when multiplied by the dose bin widths found in DVH Data (3004,0058), yields dose bin widths in the dose units as specified by Dose Units (3004,0002).

entry.name: >DVH Volume Units
entry.description: Volume axis units. Defined Terms: CM3 = cubic centimeters PERCENT = percent

entry.name: Structure Set Label
entry.description: User-defined label for Structure Set.

entry.name: Structure Set Name
entry.description: User-defined name for Structure Set.

entry.name: Structure Set Description
entry.description: User-defined description for Structure Set.

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this object Page 493 instance.

entry.name: Structure Set Date
entry.description: Date at which Structure Set was last modified.

entry.name: Structure Set Time
entry.description: Time at which Structure Set was last modified.

entry.name: Referenced Frame of Reference Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of items describing Frames of Reference in which the ROIs are defined. One or more items may be included in this sequence. See C.8.8.5.1.

entry.name: >Frame of Reference UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Frame of Reference within Structure Set. Required if Referenced Frame of Reference Sequence (3006,0010) is sent.

entry.name: >Frame of Reference Relationship Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of transforms that relate other Frames of Reference to this Frame of Reference.

entry.name: >>Related Frame of Reference UID
entry.description: Frame of Reference Coordinate System to be transformed to the current Frame of Reference. Required if Frame of Reference Relationship Sequence (3006,00C0) is sent.

entry.name: >>Frame of Reference Transformation Type
entry.description: Type of Transformation. Required if Frame of Reference Relationship Sequence (3006,00C0) is sent. Defined Terms: HOMOGENEOUS

entry.name: >>Frame of Reference Transformation Matrix
entry.description: Four-by-four transformation Matrix from Related Frame of Reference to current Frame of Reference. Matrix elements shall be listed in row-major order. Required if Frame of Reference Relationship Sequence (3006,00C0) is sent. See C.8.8.5.2.

entry.name: >>Frame of Reference Transformation Comment
entry.description: Comment regarding the transformation between the related and current Frames of Reference.

entry.name: >RT Referenced Study Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Studies containing series to be referenced. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if RT Referenced Study Sequence (3006,0012) is sent.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if RT Referenced Study Sequence (3006,0012) is sent.

entry.name: >>RT Referenced Series Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of items describing series of images within the referenced study which are used in defining the Structure Set. Required if RT Referenced Study Sequence (3006,0012) is sent. One

entry.name: ROI Contour Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Contour Sequences defining ROIs. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced ROI Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced ROI described in the Structure Set ROI Sequence (3006,0020).

entry.name: >ROI Display Color
entry.description: RGB triplet color representation for ROI, specified using the range 0-255.

entry.name: >Contour Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Contours defining ROI. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >>Contour Number
entry.description: Identification number of the contour. The value of Contour Number (3006,0048) shall be unique within the Contour Sequence (3006,0040) in which it is defined. No semantics or ordering shall be inferred from this attribute.

entry.name: >>Attached Contours
entry.description: List of Contour Number (3006,0048) defining lower-numbered contour(s) to which the current contour is connected.

include.ref: >>>Include `Image SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table 10-3

entry.name: >>Contour Image Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of images containing the contour. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >>Contour Geometric Type
entry.description: Geometric type of contour. Required if Contour Sequence (3006,0040) is sent. See C.8.8.6.1. Enumerated Values: POINT = single point OPEN_PLANAR = open contour containing coplanar points OPEN_NONPLANAR = open contour containing non-coplanar points CLOSED_PLANAR = closed contour (polygon) containing coplanar points

entry.name: >>Contour Slab Thickness
entry.description: Thickness of slab (in mm) represented by contour, where the Contour Data (3006,0050) defines a plane in the center of the slab, offset by the Contour Offset Vector (3006,0045) if it is present. See C.8.8.6.2. Page 497

entry.name: >>Contour Offset Vector
entry.description: Vector (x,y,z) in the the patient based coordinate system described in C.7.6.2.1.1 which is normal to plane of Contour Data (3006,0050), describing direction and magnitude of the offset (in mm) of each point of the central plane of a contour slab from the corresponding original point of Contour Data (3006,0050). See C.8.8.6.2.

entry.name: >>Number of Contour Points
entry.description: Number of points (triplets) in Contour Data (3006,0050). Required if Contour Sequence (3006,0040) is sent.

entry.name: >>Contour Data
entry.description: Sequence of (x,y,z) triplets defining a contour in the patient based coordinate system described in C.7.6.2.1.1 (mm). Required if Contour Sequence (3006,0040) is sent. See C.8.8.6.1 and C.8.8.6.3. Note: Contour Data may not be properly encoded if Explicit-VR transfer syntax is used and the VL of this attribute exceeds 65534 bytes.

table.ref: Table C.8-43--RT DOSE ROI MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: RT Dose ROI Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of items specifying dose levels for isodose curves or dose points described in the ROI module. One or more items may be included in this sequence. See C.8.8.7.1.

entry.name: >Referenced ROI Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced ROI within the current RT Dose. See Note 1 and C.8.8.7.2.

entry.name: >Dose Units
entry.description: Units used for ROI Dose. Enumerated Values: GY = Gray RELATIVE = dose relative to implicit reference value

entry.name: >Dose Value
entry.description: Dose value for ROI, in units defined by Dose Units (3004,0002). See C.8.8.7.3.

entry.description: Identification number of the Observation. The value of Observation Number (3006,0082) shall be unique within the RT ROI Observations Sequence (3006,0080).

entry.name: >Referenced ROI Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced ROI described in the Structure Set ROI Sequence (3006,0020).

entry.name: >ROI Observation Label
entry.description: User-defined label for ROI Observation.

entry.description: User-defined description for ROI Observation.

entry.description: Introduces sequence of significantly related ROIs, e.g. CTVs contained within a PTV. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.description: Uniquely identifies the related ROI described in the Structure Set ROI Sequence (3006,0020). Required if RT Related ROI Sequence (3006,0030) is sent.

entry.name: >>RT ROI Relationship
entry.description: Relationship of referenced ROI with

table.ref: Table C.8-45--RT GENERAL PLAN MODULE ATTRIBUTES
table.name: Table C.8-45--RT GENERAL PLAN MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: RT Plan Label
entry.description: User-defined label for treatment plan.

entry.name: RT Plan Name
entry.description: User-defined name for treatment plan.

entry.name: RT Plan Description
entry.description: User-defined description of treatment plan.

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this object instance.

entry.name: Operators' Name
entry.description: Name of operator(s) creating treatment plan.

entry.name: RT Plan Date
entry.description: Date treatment plan was last modified.

entry.name: RT Plan Time
entry.description: Time treatment plan was last modified.

entry.name: Treatment Protocols
entry.description: Planned treatment protocols.

entry.name: Plan Intent
entry.description: Intent of this plan. Defined Terms: CURATIVE = curative therapy on patient PALLIATIVE = palliative therapy on patient PROPHYLACTIC = preventative therapy on patient VERIFICATION = verification of patient plan using phantom MACHINE_QA= Quality assurance of the delivery machine (independently of a specific patient) RESEARCH = Research project SERVICE = Machine repair or maintenance operation

entry.name: Treatment Sites
entry.description: Planned treatment sites.

entry.name: RT Plan Geometry
entry.description: Describes whether RT Plan is based on patient or treatment device geometry. See C.8.8.9.1. Defined Terms: PATIENT = RT Structure Set exists TREATMENT_DEVICE = RT Structure Set does not exist

entry.name: Referenced Structure Set Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of one Class/Instance pair describing instance of RT Structure Set on which the RT Plan is based. Only a single item shall be permitted in this sequence. Required if RT Plan Geometry (300A,000C) is PATIENT.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if Referenced Structure Set Sequence (300C,0060) is sent.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if Referenced Structure Set Sequence (300C,0060) is sent. Page 503

entry.name: Referenced Dose Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of related SOP Class/Instance pairs describing related instances of RT Dose (for grids and named/unnamed point doses). One or more items may be included in this sequence. See Note 1.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if Referenced RT Dose Sequence (300C,0080) is sent.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if Referenced RT Dose Sequence (300C,0080) is sent.

entry.name: Referenced RT Plan Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of related SOP Class/Instance pairs describing related instances of RT Plan. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if Referenced RT Plan Sequence (300C,0002) is sent.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if Referenced RT Plan Sequence (300C,0002) is sent.

entry.name: >RT Plan Relationship
entry.description: Relationship of referenced plan with respect to current plan. Required if Referenced RT Plan Sequence (300C,0002) is sent. Defined Terms: PRIOR = plan delivered prior to current treatment ALTERNATIVE = alternative plan prepared for current treatment PREDECESSOR = plan used in derivation of current plan VERIFIED_PLAN = plan which is verified using the current plan. This value shall only be used if Plan Intent (300A,000A) is present and has a value of VERIFICATION.

entry.name: Prescription Description
entry.description: User-defined description of treatment prescription.

entry.name: Dose Reference Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Dose References. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Dose Reference. The value of Dose Reference Number (300A,0012) shall be unique within the RT Plan in which it is created. Required if Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0012) is sent.

entry.name: >Dose Reference UID
entry.description: A unique identifier for a Dose Reference that can be used to link the same entity across multiple RT Plan objects.

entry.name: >Dose Reference Structure Type
entry.description: Structure type of Dose Reference. Required if Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) is sent. Defined Terms: POINT = dose reference point specified as ROI VOLUME = dose reference volume specified as ROI COORDINATES = point specified by Dose Reference Point Coordinates (300A,0018) SITE = dose reference clinical site

entry.name: >Dose Reference Description
entry.description: User-defined description of Dose Reference.

entry.name: >Referenced ROI Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies ROI representing the dose reference specified by ROI Number (3006,0022) in Structure Set ROI Sequence (3006,0020) in Structure Set Module within RT Structure Set in Referenced Structure Set Sequence (300C,0060) in RT General Plan Module. Required if Dose Reference Structure Type (300A,0014) is POINT or VOLUME and Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) is sent.

entry.name: >Dose Reference Point Coordinates
entry.description: Coordinates (x,y,z) of Reference Point in the patient based coordinate system described in C.7.6.2.1.1 (mm). Required if Dose Reference Structure Type (300A,0014) is COORDINATES and Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) is sent.

entry.name: >Nominal Prior Dose
entry.description: Dose (in Gy) from prior treatment to this Dose Reference (e.g. from a previous Page 505 course of treatment).

entry.name: >Dose Reference Type
entry.description: Type of Dose Reference. Required if Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) is sent. Defined Terms: TARGET = treatment target (corresponding to GTV, PTV, or CTV in ICRU50) ORGAN_AT_RISK = Organ at Risk (as defined in ICRU50)

entry.name: >Constraint Weight
entry.description: Relative importance of satisfying constraint, where high values represent more important constraints.

entry.name: >Delivery Warning Dose
entry.description: The dose (in Gy) which when reached or exceeded should cause some action to be taken.

entry.name: >Delivery Maximum Dose
entry.description: The maximum dose (in Gy) which can be delivered to the dose reference.

entry.name: >Target Minimum Dose
entry.description: Minimum permitted dose (in Gy) to Dose Reference if Dose Reference Type (300A,0020) is TARGET.

entry.name: >Target Prescription Dose
entry.description: Prescribed dose (in Gy) to Dose Reference if Dose Reference Type (300A,0020) is TARGET.

entry.name: >Target Maximum Dose
entry.description: Maximum permitted dose (in Gy) to Dose Reference if Dose Reference Type (300A,0020) is TARGET.

entry.name: >Target Underdose Volume Fraction
entry.description: Maximum permitted fraction (in percent) of Target to receive less than the Target Prescription Dose if Dose Reference Type (300A,0020) is TARGET and Dose Reference Structure Type (300A,0014) is VOLUME. See C.8.8.10.1.

entry.name: >Organ at Risk Full-volume Dose
entry.description: Maximum dose (in Gy) to entire Dose Reference if Dose Reference Type (300A,0020) is ORGAN_AT_RISK and Dose Reference Structure Type (300A,0014) is VOLUME.

entry.name: >Organ at Risk Limit Dose
entry.description: Maximum permitted dose (in Gy) to any part of Dose Reference if Dose Reference Type (300A,0020) is ORGAN_AT_RISK and Dose Reference Structure Type (300A,0014) is VOLUME.

entry.name: >Organ at Risk Maximum Dose
entry.description: Maximum dose (in Gy) to non-overdosed part of Dose Reference if Dose Reference Type (300A,0020) is ORGAN_AT_RISK and Dose Reference Structure Type (300A,0014) is VOLUME.

entry.name: >Organ at Risk Overdose Volume Fraction
entry.description: Maximum permitted fraction (in percent) of the Organ at Risk to receive more than the Organ at Risk Maximum Dose if Dose

entry.name: Tolerance Table Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of tolerance tables to be used for delivery of treatment plan. One or more items may be included in this sequence. See Note 1.

entry.name: >Tolerance Table Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Tolerance Table. The value of Tolerance Table Number (300A,0042) shall be unique within the RT Plan in which it is created. Required if Tolerance Table Sequence (300A,0040) is sent.

entry.name: >Tolerance Table Label
entry.description: User-defined label for Tolerance Table.

entry.name: >Gantry Angle Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in degrees) between planned and delivered Gantry Angle.

entry.name: >Gantry Pitch Angle Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in degrees) between planned and delivered Gantry Pitch Angle.

entry.name: >Beam Limiting Device Angle Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in degrees) between planned and delivered Beam Limiting Device Angle.

entry.name: >Beam Limiting Device Tolerance Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of beam limiting device (collimator) tolerances. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >>RT Beam Limiting Device Type
entry.description: Type of beam limiting device (collimator). Required if Beam Limiting Device Tolerance Sequence (300A,0048) is sent. Enumerated Values: X = symmetric jaw pair in IEC X direction Y = symmetric jaw pair in IEC Y direction ASYMX = asymmetric jaw pair in IEC X direction ASYMY = asymmetric pair in IEC Y direction MLCX = multileaf (multi-element) jaw pair in IEC X direction MLCY = multileaf (multi-element) jaw pair in IEC Y direction Page 507

entry.name: >>Beam Limiting Device Position Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in mm) between planned and delivered leaf (element) or jaw positions for current beam limiting device (collimator). Required if Beam Limiting Device Tolerance Sequence (300A,0048) is sent.

entry.name: >Patient Support Angle Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in degrees) between planned and delivered Patient Support Angle.

entry.name: >Table Top Eccentric Angle Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in degrees) between planned and delivered Table Top Eccentric Angle.

entry.name: >Table Top Vertical Position Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in mm) between planned and delivered Table Top Vertical Position.

entry.name: >Table Top Longitudinal Position Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in mm) between planned and delivered Table Top Longitudinal Position.

entry.name: >Table Top Lateral Position Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in mm) between planned and delivered Table Top Lateral Position.

entry.name: Patient Setup Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of patient setup data for current plan. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.description: Identification number of the Patient Setup. The value of Patient Setup Number (300A,0182) shall be unique within the RT Plan in which it is created.

entry.name: >Patient Setup Label
entry.description: The user-defined label for the patient setup.

entry.name: >Patient Position
entry.description: Patient position descriptor relative to the equipment. Required if Patient Additional Position (300A,0184) is not present. See Section C.7.3.1.1.2 for Defined Terms and further explanation.

table.name: Table C.8-49--RT FRACTION SCHEME MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Fraction Group Sequence

entry.name: >Fraction Group Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Fraction Group. The value of Fraction Group Number (300A,0071) shall be unique within

entry.name: Beam Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of treatment beams for current RT Plan. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Beam Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Beam. The value of Beam Number (300A,00C0) shall be unique within the RT Plan in which it is created. See Note 1.

entry.name: >Beam Name
entry.description: User-defined name for Beam. See Note 1.

entry.name: >Beam Description
entry.description: User-defined description for Beam. See Note 1.

entry.name: >Beam Type
entry.description: Motion characteristic of Beam. See Note 5. Enumerated Values: STATIC = All Control Point Sequence (300A,0111) attributes remain unchanged between consecutive pairs of control points with changing Cumulative Meterset Weight (300A,0134). DYNAMIC = One or more Control Point Sequence (300A,0111) attributes change between one or more consecutive pairs of control points with changing Cumulative Meterset Weight (300A,0134).

entry.name: >Radiation Type
entry.description: Particle type of Beam. Defined Terms: PHOTON ELECTRON NEUTRON PROTON

entry.description: Type of high-dose treatment technique. Defined Terms: NORMAL = Standard treatment TBI = Total Body Irradiation HDR = High Dose Rate Required if treatment technique requires a dose that would normally require overriding of treatment machine safety controls.

entry.name: >Treatment Machine Name
entry.description: User-defined name identifying treatment machine to be used for beam delivery. See Note 2.

entry.name: >Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of the equipment to be used for beam delivery. Page 517

entry.name: >Institution Name
entry.description: Institution where the equipment is located that is to be used for beam delivery.

entry.name: >Institution Address
entry.description: Mailing address of the institution where the equipment is located that is to be used for beam delivery.

entry.name: >Institutional Department Name
entry.description: Department in the institution where the equipment is located that is to be used for beam delivery.

entry.name: >Manufacturer's Model Name

entry.name: >Device Serial Number

entry.name: >Primary Dosimeter Unit
entry.description: Measurement unit of machine dosimeter. See C.8.8.14.1. Enumerated Values: MU = Monitor Unit MINUTE = minute

entry.name: >Referenced Tolerance Table Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Tolerance Table specified by Tolerance Table Number (300A,0042) within Tolerance Table Sequence in RT Tolerance Tables Module. These tolerances are to be used for verification of treatment machine settings.

entry.name: >Source-Axis Distance
entry.description: Radiation source to Gantry rotation axis distance of the equipment that is to be used for beam delivery (mm).

entry.name: >Beam Limiting Device Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of beam limiting device (collimator) jaw or leaf (element) sets. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >>RT Beam Limiting Device Type
entry.description: Type of beam limiting device (collimator). Enumerated Values: X = symmetric jaw pair in IEC X direction Y = symmetric jaw pair in IEC Y direction ASYMX = asymmetric jaw pair in IEC X direction ASYMY = asymmetric pair in IEC Y direction MLCX = multileaf (multi-element) jaw pair in IEC X direction MLCY = multileaf (multi-element) jaw pair in IEC Y direction

entry.name: >>Source to Beam Limiting Device Distance
entry.description: Radiation source to beam limiting device (collimator) distance of the equipment that is to be used for beam delivery (mm).

entry.description: Department in the institution where the equipment is located that is to be used for treatment delivery.

entry.description: Manufacturer's model name of the equipment that is to be used for treatment delivery.

entry.name: >Device Serial Number

entry.description: Measurement unit of Source Strength. Required if the source is not a gamma-

entry.name: Approval Status

table.ref: Table C.8-53--RT GENERAL TREATMENT RECORD MODULE ATTRIBUTES
table.name: Table C.8-53--RT GENERAL TREATMENT RECORD MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: Instance number identifying this particular instance of the object.

entry.name: Treatment Date
entry.description: Date when current fraction was delivered, or Date last fraction was delivered in case of RT Treatment Summary Record IOD. See Note.

entry.name: Treatment Time
entry.description: Time when current fraction was delivered (begun), or Time last fraction was delivered (begun) in case of RT Treatment Summary Record IOD. See Note.

entry.name: Referenced RT Plan Sequence
entry.description: A sequence which provides reference to a RT Plan SOP Class/Instance pair. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if Referenced RT Plan Sequence (300C,0002) is sent.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if Referenced RT Plan Sequence (300C,0002) is sent.

entry.name: Referenced Treatment Record Sequence
entry.description: A sequence which provides reference to RT Treatment Record SOP Class/Instance pairs to which the current RT Treatment Record is significantly related. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if Referenced Treatment Record Sequence (3008,0030) is sent.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if Referenced Treatment Record Sequence (3008,0030)

table.ref: Table C.8-54--RT TREATMENT MACHINE RECORD MODULE ATTRIBUTES
table.name: Table C.8-54--RT TREATMENT MACHINE RECORD MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Treatment Machine Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence describing treatment machine used for treatment delivery. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Treatment Machine Name
entry.description: User-defined name identifying treatment machine used for treatment delivery.

entry.name: >Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of the equipment used for treatment delivery.

entry.name: >Institution Name
entry.description: Institution where the equipment is located that was used for treatment delivery.

entry.name: >Institution Address
entry.description: Mailing address of the institution where the equipment is located that was used for treatment delivery.

entry.name: >Institutional Department Name
entry.description: Department in the institution where the equipment is located that was used for treatment delivery.

entry.name: >Manufacturer's Model Name
entry.description: Manufacturer's model name of the equipment used for treatment delivery.

entry.name: >Device Serial Number
entry.description: Manufacturer's serial number of the equipment used for treatment delivery.

table.ref: Table C.8-55--MEASURED DOSE REFERENCE RECORD MODULE ATTRIBUTES
table.name: Table C.8-55--MEASURED DOSE REFERENCE RECORD MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Measured Dose Reference Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of doses measured during treatment delivery, summed over entire session. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >Referenced Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Dose Reference specified by Dose Reference Number (300A,0012) in Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) in RT Prescription Module of referenced RT Plan. Required only if Measured Dose Reference Number (3008,0064) is not sent. It shall not be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Measured Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Unique identifier of measured dose point. Page 547 Required only if Referenced Dose Reference Number (300C,0051) is not sent. It shall not be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Dose Units
entry.description: Units used to describe measured dose. Enumerated Values: GY = Gray RELATIVE = Dose relative to implicit reference value

entry.name: >Measured Dose Value
entry.description: Measured Dose in units specified by Dose Units (3004,0002).

entry.name: >Measured Dose Type
entry.description: Type of dose measurement. Defined Terms: DIODE = semiconductor diode TLD = thermoluminescent dosimeter ION_CHAMBER = ion chamber GEL = dose sensitive gel EPID = electronic portal imaging device FILM = dose sensitive film

entry.name: >Measured Dose Description
entry.description: User-defined description of Dose Reference (e.g. "Exit dose", "Point A").

table.ref: Table C.8-56--CALCULATED DOSE REFERENCE RECORD MODULE ATTRIBUTES
table.name: Table C.8-56--CALCULATED DOSE REFERENCE RECORD MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Calculated Dose Reference Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of doses estimated for each treatment delivery. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >Referenced Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Dose Reference specified by Dose Reference Number (300A,0012) in Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) in RT Prescription Module of referenced RT Plan. Required only if Calculated Dose Reference Number (3008,0072) is not sent. It shall not be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Calculated Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Unique identifier of dose reference point within RT Treatment Record IOD. Required only if Referenced Dose Reference Number (300C,0051) is not sent. It shall not be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Calculated Dose Reference Dose
entry.description: Calculated Dose (Gy).

table.ref: Table C.8-57--RT BEAMS SESSION RECORD MODULE ATTRIBUTES
table.name: Table C.8-57--RT BEAMS SESSION RECORD MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Operators' Name
entry.description: Name of operator administering treatment session.

entry.name: Referenced Fraction Group Number
entry.description: Identifier of Fraction Group within referenced RT Plan.

entry.name: Number of Fractions Planned
entry.description: Total number of treatments (Fractions) planned for current Fraction Group.

entry.name: Primary Dosimeter Unit
entry.description: Measurement unit of machine dosimeter. Enumerated Values: MU = Monitor Unit MINUTE = minute

entry.name: Treatment Session Beam Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Beams administered during treatment session. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >Referenced Beam Number
entry.description: References Beam specified by Beam Number (300A,00C0) in Beam Sequence (300A,00B0) in RT Beams Module within referenced RT Plan.

entry.name: >Beam Name
entry.description: User-defined name for delivered Beam.

entry.name: >Beam Description
entry.description: User-defined description for delivered Beam.

entry.name: >Beam Type
entry.description: Motion characteristic of delivered Beam. Enumerated Values: STATIC = all beam parameters remain unchanged during delivery DYNAMIC = one or more beam parameters changes during delivery

entry.name: >Radiation Type
entry.description: Particle type of delivered Beam. Defined Terms: PHOTON, ELECTRON, NEUTRON, PROTON.

entry.name: >High-Dose Technique Type
entry.description: Type of high-dose treatment technique. Defined Terms: NORMAL = Standard treatment TBI = Total Body Irradiation HDR = High Dose Rate Required if treatment technique requires a dose that would normally require overriding of treatment machine safety controls.

entry.name: >Referenced Verification Image Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of verification images obtained during delivery of current beam. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if Referenced Verification Image Sequence (300C,0040) is sent. Page 549

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if Referenced Verification Image Sequence (300C,0040) is sent.

entry.name: >>Start Meterset
entry.description: Cumulative Meterset Weight within Beam referenced by Referenced Beam Number at which image acquisition starts.

entry.name: >>End Meterset
entry.description: Cumulative Meterset Weight within Beam referenced by Referenced Beam Number at which image acquisition ends.

entry.name: >Referenced Measured Dose Reference Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of doses measured during treatment delivery for current Beam. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>Referenced Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Uniquely references Dose Reference specified by Dose Reference Number (300A,0012) in Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) in RT Prescription Module of referenced RT Plan. Required if Referenced Measured Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0080) is sent and Referenced Measured Dose Reference Number (3008,0082) is not sent. It shall not be present otherwise.

entry.name: >>Referenced Measured Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Uniquely references Measured Dose Reference specified by Measured Dose Reference Number (3008,0064) in Measured Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0010). Required if Referenced Measured Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0080) is sent and Referenced Dose Reference Number (300C,0051) is not sent. It shall not be present otherwise.

entry.name: >>Measured Dose Value
entry.description: Measured Dose in units specified by Dose Units (3004,0002) in sequence referenced by Measured Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0010) or Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) in RT Prescription Module of referenced RT Plan as defined above. Required if Referenced Measured Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0080) is sent.

entry.name: >Referenced Calculated Dose Reference Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of doses estimated for each treatment delivery. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>Referenced Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Dose Reference specified by Dose Reference Number (300A,0012) in Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) in RT Prescription Module of referenced RT Plan. Required if Referenced Calculated Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0090) is sent and Referenced Calculated Dose Reference

table.ref: Table C.8-58--RT BRACHY SESSION RECORD MODULE ATTRIBUTES
