table.name: Table C.8-58--RT BRACHY SESSION RECORD MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Operators' Name
entry.description: Name of operator administering treatment session.

entry.name: Referenced Fraction Group Number
entry.description: Identifier of Fraction Group within referenced RT Plan.

entry.name: Number of Fractions Planned
entry.description: Total number of treatments (Fractions) planned for current Fraction Group.

entry.name: Brachy Treatment Technique
entry.description: Type of brachytherapy treatment technique. Enumerated Values: INTRALUMENARY, INTRACAVITARY, INTERSTITIAL, CONTACT, INTRAVASCULAR, PERMANENT. See RT Plan IOD.

entry.name: Brachy Treatment Type
entry.description: Type of brachytherapy treatment. Defined Terms: MANUAL = manually positioned HDR = High dose rate MDR = Medium dose rate LDR = Low dose rate PDR = Pulsed dose rate

entry.name: Recorded Source Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Sources to be used within Application Setups. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >Source Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Source. The value of Source Number (300A,0212) shall be unique within the Recorded Source Sequence (3008,0100) in which it is created.

entry.name: >Source Type
entry.description: Type of Source. Defined Terms: POINT, LINE, CYLINDER, SPHERE.

entry.name: >Source Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of source.

table.ref: Table C.8-59--RT TREATMENT SUMMARY RECORD MODULE ATTRIBUTES
table.name: Table C.8-59--RT TREATMENT SUMMARY RECORD MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Current Treatment Status
entry.description: Status of the Treatment at the time the Treatment Summary was created. Enumerated Values: NOT_STARTED, ON_TREATMENT, ON_BREAK, SUSPENDED, STOPPED, COMPLETED. See C.8.8.23.1.

entry.name: Treatment Status Comment
entry.description: Comment on current treatment status.

entry.name: First Treatment Date
entry.description: Date of delivery of the first treatment.

entry.name: Most Recent Treatment Date
entry.description: Date of delivery of the most recent

table.name: RT ION TOLERANCE TABLES MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Ion Tolerance Table Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of ion tolerance tables to be used for delivery of treatment plan. One or more items shall be included in this sequence. See Note 1.

entry.name: >Tolerance Table Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Tolerance Table. The value of Tolerance Table Number (300A,0042) shall be unique within the RT Ion Plan in which it is created.

entry.name: >Tolerance Table Label
entry.description: User-defined label for Tolerance Table.

entry.name: >Gantry Angle Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in degrees) between planned and delivered Gantry Angle.

entry.name: >Beam Limiting Device Angle Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in degrees) between planned and delivered Beam Limiting Device Angle.

entry.name: >Beam Limiting Device Tolerance Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of beam limiting device (collimator) tolerances. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >>RT Beam Limiting Device Type
entry.description: Type of beam limiting device (collimator). Enumerated Values: X = symmetric jaw pair in IEC X direction Y = symmetric jaw pair in IEC Y direction ASYMX = asymmetric jaw pair in IEC X direction ASYMY = asymmetric pair in IEC Y direction MLCX = multileaf (multi-element) jaw pair in IEC X direction MLCY = multileaf (multi-element) jaw pair in IEC Y direction

entry.name: >>Beam Limiting Device Position Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in mm) between planned and delivered leaf (element) or jaw positions for current beam limiting device (collimator).

entry.name: >Patient Support Angle Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in degrees) between planned and delivered Patient Support Angle.

entry.name: >Table Top Vertical Position Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in mm) between planned and delivered Table Top Vertical Position. Page 575

entry.name: >Table Top Longitudinal Position Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in mm) between planned and delivered Table Top Longitudinal Position.

entry.name: >Table Top Lateral Position Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in mm) between planned and delivered Table Top Lateral Position.

entry.name: >Table Top Pitch Angle Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in degrees) between planned and delivered Table Top Pitch Angle.

entry.name: >Table Top Roll Angle Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in degrees) between planned and delivered Table Top Roll Angle.

entry.name: >Snout Position Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in mm) between planned and delivered Snout Position.

entry.name: Ion Beam Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of setup and/or treatment beams for current RT Ion Plan. One or more items shall be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Beam Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Beam. The value of Beam Number (300A,00C0) shall be unique within the RT Ion Plan in which it is created. See section C.8.8.25.1.

entry.name: >Beam Name
entry.description: User-defined name for Beam. See section C.8.8.25.1.

entry.name: >Beam Description
entry.description: User-defined description for Beam. See section C.8.8.25.1.

entry.name: >Beam Type
entry.description: Motion characteristic of Beam. Enumerated Values: STATIC = all beam parameters remain unchanged during delivery DYNAMIC = one or more beam parameters changes during delivery

entry.name: >Radiation Type
entry.description: Particle type of Beam.

table.name: RT ION BEAMS SESSION RECORD MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Operators' Name
entry.description: Name of operator administering treatment session.

entry.name: Referenced Fraction Group Number
entry.description: Identifier of fraction group within referenced RT Ion Plan.

entry.name: Number of Fractions Planned
entry.description: Total number of treatments (fractions) planned for current fraction group.

entry.name: Primary Dosimeter Unit
entry.description: Measurement unit of the machine dosimeter. Enumerated Values:

table.name: BEAM LIMITING DEVICE POSITION MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Beam Limiting Device Position Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of beam limiting device (collimator) jaw or leaf (element) positions. Required if Ion Beam Limiting Device Sequence (300A,03A4) is included and for first item of Control Point Sequence, or if Beam Limiting Device changes during Beam. One or more items shall be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >RT Beam Limiting Device Type
entry.description: Type of beam limiting device (collimator). The value of this attribute shall correspond

entry.name: Patient Support Type
entry.description: Defined terms: TABLE = Treatment delivery system table CHAIR = Treatment delivery system chair See section C.8.8.25.6.3.

entry.name: Patient Support ID
entry.description: User-specified identifier for manufacturer specific patient support devices.

entry.name: Patient Support Accessory Code
entry.description: A Patient Support accessory identifier to be read by a device such as a bar code reader. Page 619

table.ref: Table C.8-60 - PET SERIES MODULE ATTRIBUTES
table.name: Table C.8-60 - PET SERIES MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Series Date
entry.description: Date the Series started. See C.8.9.1.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Series Time
entry.description: Time the Series started. See C.8.9.1.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Units
entry.description: Pixel value units. See C.8.9.1.1.3 for explanation. Defined terms: CNTS, NONE, CM2, PCNT, CPS, BQML, MGMINML, UMOLMINML, MLMING, MLG, 1CM, UMOLML, PROPCNTS, PROPCPS, MLMINML, MLML, GML, STDDEV

entry.name: Counts Source
entry.description: The primary source of counts. The primary source leads to the underlying image Units (0054,1001), as opposed to secondary sources which are used during reconstruction correction. Enumerated Values: EMISSION TRANSMISSION

entry.name: Series Type
entry.description: A multi-valued indicator of the type of Series. See C.8.9.1.1.4 for explanation. Value 1 Enumerated Values: STATIC DYNAMIC GATED WHOLE BODY Value 2 Enumerated Values: IMAGE REPROJECTION

entry.name: Reprojection Method
entry.description: Method for projecting volumetric data onto planar projection. Required if Series Type (0054,1000), Value 2 is REPROJECTION. Defined terms: SUM MAX PIXEL

entry.name: Number of R-R Intervals
entry.description: The maximum number of R-R Intervals that may exist in this Series. Required if Series Type (0054,1000), Value 1 is GATED.

entry.name: Number of Time Slots
entry.description: The maximum number of Time Slots that may exist in this Series. Required if Series Type (0054,1000), Value 1 is GATED.

table.ref: Table C.8-61 - PET ISOTOPE MODULE ATTRIBUTES
table.name: Table C.8-61 - PET ISOTOPE MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Radiopharmaceutical Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items that describe isotope information. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 4020 .

entry.name: >Radionuclide Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the radionuclide. This sequence shall contain exactly one item.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Route
entry.description: Route of administration.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 11 .

entry.name: >Administration Route Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the administration route of the radiopharmaceutical. This sequence shall contain exactly one item.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Volume
entry.description: Volume of administered radiopharmaceutical in cubic cm.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Start Time
entry.description: Time of start of administration. The actual time of radiopharmaceutical administration to the patient for imaging purposes, using the same time base as Series Time (0008,0031). The use of this Attribute is deprecated in favor of Radiopharmaceutical Start Datetime (0018,1078). Note: The use of a time alone can cause confusion when the procedure spans midnight.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Start Datetime
entry.description: Date and time of start of administration. The actual date and time of radiopharmaceutical administration to the patient for imaging purposes, using the same time base as Series Time (0008,0031).

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Stop Time
entry.description: Time of end of administration. The actual ending time of radiopharmaceutical administration to the patient for imaging purposes, using the same time base as Series Time (0008,0031). The use of this Attribute is deprecated in favor of Radiopharmaceutical Stop Datetime (0018,1079). Note: The use of a time alone can cause confusion when the procedure spans midnight.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Stop Datetime
entry.description: Date and time of end of administration. The actual ending date and time of radiopharmaceutical administration to the Page 629 patient for imaging purposes, using the same time base as Series Time (0008,0031).

entry.name: >Radionuclide Total Dose
entry.description: The radiopharmaceutical dose administered to the patient measured in Becquerels (Bq) at the Radiopharmaceutical Start Time (0018,1072). Note: In other IODs, such as the NM IOD, this same attribute is specified in MegaBecquerels (MBq).

entry.name: >Radionuclide Half Life
entry.description: The radionuclide half life, in seconds, that was used in the correction of this image.

entry.name: >Radionuclide Positron Fraction
entry.description: The radionuclide positron fraction (fraction of decays that are by positron emission) that was used in the correction of this image.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Specific Activity
entry.description: The activity per unit mass of the radiopharmaceutical, in Bq/micromole, at the Radiopharmaceutical Start Time (0018,1072).

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical
entry.description: Name of the radiopharmaceutical.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 4021 .

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the radiopharmaceutical. This sequence shall contain exactly one item.

entry.name: Intervention Drug Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describes the intervention drugs used. Zero or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Name
entry.description: Name of the intervention drug.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 10 .

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the intervention drug name.

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Start Time
entry.description: Time of administration of the intervention drug, using the same time base as for the Series Time (0008,0031).

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Stop Time
entry.description: Time of completion of administration of the intervention drug, using the same time base as for the Series Time (0008,0031).

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Dose
entry.description: Intervention drug dose, in mg.

table.ref: Table C.8-63 - PET IMAGE MODULE ATTRIBUTES
table.name: Table C.8-63 - PET IMAGE MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics. See C.8.9.4.1.1 for specialization.

entry.name: Samples per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (planes) in this image. This value shall be 1.

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. See C.8.9.4.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated. Enumerated values: 16.

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits stored. The value shall be the same as the value in Bits Allocated (0028,0100).

entry.name: High Bit
entry.description: Most significant bit for pixel sample data. Each sample shall have the same high bit. Shall be one less than the value in Bits Stored (0028,0101).

entry.name: Rescale Intercept
entry.description: The value b in relationship between stored values (SV) and pixel value units (U) defined in Units (0054,1001): U = m*SV+b. The Rescale Intercept is always zero for PET images.

entry.name: Rescale Slope
entry.description: m in the equation specified in Rescale Intercept (0028,1052).

entry.name: Frame Reference Time
entry.description: The time that the pixel values in the image occurred. Frame Reference Time is the offset, in msec, from the Series reference time. See explanation in C.8.9.4.1.5.

entry.name: Trigger Time
entry.description: Time interval, in msec, from the start of the trigger to the beginning of data acquisition for this image. Required if Series Type (0054,1000), Value 1 is GATED.

entry.name: Frame Time
entry.description: Nominal duration per individual frame, in msec. Required if Series Type (0054,1000), Value 1 is GATED. See C.8.9.4.1.3 for explanation.

entry.name: Low R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval lower limit for beat rejection, in msec. Required if Series Type (0054,1000), Value 1 is GATED and Beat Rejection Flag (0018,1080) is Y.

entry.name: High R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval upper limit for beat rejection, in msec. Required if Series Type

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Type of equipment that originally acquired the data used to create the images in this Series. Enumerated Values: DX PX IO MG See section C.7.3.1.1.1 for further explanation.

include.ref: Include 'General Anatomy Required Macro' Table 10-6

entry.name: Image Laterality
entry.description: Laterality of (possibly paired) body part (as described in Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218)) examined. Enumerated Values: R = right L = left U = unpaired B = both left and right Note: This Attribute is mandatory, in order to ensure that images may be positioned correctly relative to one another for display. Shall be consistent with any laterality information contained in Primary Anatomic Structure Modifier Sequence (0008,2230), if present. Note: Laterality (0020,0060) is a Series level Attribute and must be the same for all Images in the Series, hence it must be absent. Defined Context ID for the Anatomic Region Sequence is 4009. This is the anatomic region that is placed on the table Page 641 or bucky for examination. Note: It is strongly recommended that Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218) be sent with a value, in order to ensure that images may be positioned correctly relative to one another for display.

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics. See C.8.11.3.1.1 for specialization.

entry.name: Samples per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples in this image. Shall have an Enumerated Value of 1.

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. Enumerated Values: MONOCHROME1 MONOCHROME2

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Enumerated Values: 8, 16

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Enumerated Values: 6 to 16

entry.name: High Bit
entry.description: Most significant bit for pixel sample data. Shall have an Enumerated Value of one less than the value in Bit Stored (0028,0101).

entry.name: Pixel Representation
entry.description: Data representation of the pixel samples. Shall have the Enumerated Value: 0000H = Unsigned Integer.

entry.name: Pixel Intensity Relationship
entry.description: The relationship between the Pixel sample values and the X-Ray beam intensity. Enumerated Values: LIN = Linearly proportional to X-Ray beam intensity

entry.name: Detector Type
entry.description: The type of detector used to acquire this image. Defined Terms: DIRECT = X-Ray photoconductor SCINTILLATOR = Phosphor used STORAGE = Storage phosphor FILM = Scanned film/screen

entry.name: Detector Configuration
entry.description: The physical configuration of the detector. Page 649 Defined Terms: AREA = single or tiled detector SLOT = scanned slot, slit or spot

entry.name: Detector Description
entry.description: Free text description of detector.

entry.name: Detector Mode
entry.description: Text description of operating mode of detector (implementation specific).

entry.name: Detector ID
entry.description: The ID or serial number of the detector used to acquire this image.

entry.name: Date of Last Detector Calibration
entry.description: The date on which the detector used to acquire this image as identified in Detector ID (0018,700A) was last calibrated.

entry.name: Time of Last Detector Calibration
entry.description: The time at which the detector used to acquire this image as identified in Detector ID (0018,700A) was last calibrated.

entry.name: Exposures on Detector Since Last Calibration
entry.description: Total number of X-Ray exposures that have been made on the detector used to acquire this image as identified in Detector ID (0018,700A) since it was calibrated.

entry.name: Exposures on Detector Since Manufactured
entry.description: Total number of X-Ray exposures that have been made on the detector used to acquire this image as identified in Detector ID (0018,700A) since it was manufactured.

entry.name: Detector Time Since Last Exposure
entry.description: Time in Seconds since an exposure was last made on this detector prior to the acquisition of this image.

entry.name: Detector Binning
entry.description: Number of active detectors used to generate a single pixel. Specified as number of row detectors per pixel then column.

entry.name: Detector Manufacturer Name
entry.description: Name of the manufacturer of the detector component of the acquisition system

entry.name: Detector Manufacturer's Model Name
entry.description: Model name of the detector component of the acquisition system

entry.name: Detector Conditions Nominal Flag
entry.description: Whether or not the detector is operating within normal tolerances during this image acquisition. Enumerated Values: YES NO Note: This flag is intended to indicate whether or not there may have been some compromise of the diagnostic quality of the image due to some condition such as over-temperature, etc.

entry.name: Detector Temperature
entry.description: Detector temperature during exposure in degrees Celsius.

entry.name: Sensitivity
entry.description: Detector sensitivity in manufacturer specific units.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1. Baseline Context ID 4012

entry.name: Projection Eponymous Name Code Sequence
entry.description: A Sequence that describes the radiographic method of patient, tube and detector positioning to achieve a well Page 655 described projection or view. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence. Shall be consistent with the other Attributes in this Module, if present, but may more specifically describe the image acquisition.

entry.name: Patient Position
entry.description: Description of imaging subject's position relative to the equipment. See C.7.3.1.1.2 for Defined Terms and further explanation. If present, shall be consistent with Patient Gantry Relationship Code Sequence (0054,0414) and Patient Orientation Modifier Code Sequence (0054,0412).

entry.name: View Position
entry.description: Radiographic view of the image relative to the imaging subject's orientation. Shall be consistent with View Code Sequence (0054,0220). See C.8.11.5.1.1 for further explanation.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1. Baseline Context ID 4010

entry.name: View Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that describes the projection of the anatomic region of interest on the image receptor. Note: It is strongly recommended that this Attribute be present, in order to ensure that images may be positioned correctly relative to one another for display. Shall be consistent with View Position (0018,5101). See C.8.11.5.1.1 for further explanation. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1. Baseline Context ID 4011

entry.name: >View Modifier Code Sequence
entry.description: View modifier. Zero or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1. Baseline Context ID 19

entry.name: Patient Orientation Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that describes the orientation of the patient with respect to gravity. See C.8.11.5.1.2 for further explanation. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

entry.name: > Patient Orientation Modifier Code
entry.description: Patient Orientation Modifier.

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Type of equipment that originally acquired the data used to create the images in this Series. Enumerated Value: MG See section C.7.3.1.1.1 for further explanation.

include.ref: >Include Request Attributes Macro Table 10-9 For Reason for Requested Procedure Code

entry.name: Request Attributes Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that contains attributes from the Imaging Service Request. The sequence may have one or more Items. Sequence (0040,100A) the Baseline Context IDs are 6051 and 6055. No Baseline Context IDs are defined for other Attributes. Note: For example, Requested Procedure Code Sequence (0040,100A) may be used to convey whether the images in the Series were taken for screening or diagnostic purposes.

entry.name: Positioner Type
entry.description: Enumerated Values: MAMMOGRAPHIC NONE

entry.name: Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to detector center on the chest wall line Notes: 1. This value is traditionally referred to as Source Image Distance (SID). 2. See C.8.11.7.1.1.

entry.name: Distance Source to Patient
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to the bucky side that is closest to the Imaging Subject, as measured along the X-Ray beam vector. Notes: 1. This value is traditionally referred to as Source Object Distance (SOD). 2. See notes for this attribute in C.8.11.5 DX Positioning Module. 3. See C.8.11.7.1.1 for description of X-Ray beam vector.

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Type of equipment that originally acquired the data used to create the images in this Series.

entry.name: Positioner Type
entry.description: Enumerated Values: NONE CEPHALOSTAT RIGID

entry.name: Image Laterality
entry.description: Laterality of the region examined. Enumerated Values: R = right L = left B = both (i.e. midline)

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1. DefinedContext ID 4016.

entry.name: Anatomic Region Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the anatomic region of interest in this image. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1. DefinedContext ID 4017.

entry.name: >Anatomic Region Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that refines the anatomic region of interest in this image. Required if Primary Anatomic Structure Sequence (0008,2228) is not sent. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1. DefinedContext ID 4018 or 4019. See C.8.11.9.1.1

entry.name: Primary Anatomic Structure Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that describes the primary anatomic structures of interest in this image. See C.8.11.9.1.1 for further explanation. Required if Anatomic Region Modifier Sequence (0008,2220) is not sent. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence. for further explanation. Page 667

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics. See C.8.12.1.1.6 for specialization.

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. See C.8.12.1.1.1 for specialization of this Attribute.

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated. See C.8.12.1.1.2 for specialization of this Attribute. See PS 3.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits stored. See C.8.12.1.1.2 for specialization of this Attribute. See PS 3.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: High Bit
entry.description: Most significant bit for pixel sample data. Each sample shall have the same high bit. See C.8.12.1.1.2 for specialization of this Attribute. See PS 3.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Pixel Representation
entry.description: Data representation of the pixel samples. Each sample shall have the same pixel representation. See Section C.8.12.1.1.3 for specialization of this Attribute.

entry.name: Samples per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (planes) per image. See C.8.12.1.1.4 for specialization of this Attribute.

entry.name: Planar Configuration
entry.description: Indicates whether the pixel data are sent color-by-plane or color-by-pixel. Required if Samples per Pixel (0028,0002) has a value greater than 1. See C.8.12.1.1.5 for specialization of this Attribute.

entry.name: Content Time
entry.description: The time the image pixel data creation started. Required if the Image is part of a series in which the images are temporally related. Note: This Attribute was formerly known as Image Time.

entry.name: Lossy Image Compression
entry.description: Specifies whether an Image has undergone lossy compression. Enumerated Values: 00 = Image has NOT been subjected to lossy compression. 01 = Image has been subjected to lossy compression. See C.7.6.1.1.5

include.ref: >Include `Image SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table 10-3

entry.name: Referenced Image Sequence
entry.description: A Sequence that references other images significantly Page 669 related to this image. One or more items may be included in this sequence. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 is present and has a value of "STEREO L" or "STEREO R". May also be present otherwise. See Section C.8.12.1.1.7.

entry.name: >Purpose of Reference Code
entry.description: Describes the purpose for which the reference is made. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

table.name: MR IMAGE AND SPECTROSCOPY INSTANCE MACRO

entry.name: Acquisition Number
entry.description: A number identifying the single continuous gathering of data over a period of time that resulted in this image. Note: This number is not required to be unique across SOP Instances in a series. See also the description of the Referenced Raw Data Sequence (0008,9121).

entry.name: Acquisition Datetime
entry.description: The date and time that the acquisition of data started. Note: The synchronization of this time with an external clock is specified in the synchronization Module in Acquisition Time synchronized (0018,1800). Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Acquisition Duration
entry.description: The time in seconds needed to run the prescribed pulse sequence. See C.7.6.16.2.2.1 for further explanation. Required if Image Type (0008,0008)

entry.name: Complex Image Component
entry.description: Representation of complex data of frames in the SOP Instance. See C.8.13.3.1.5 for a description and Defined Terms.

entry.name: Acquisition Contrast
entry.description: Indication of acquisition contrast used with frames in the SOP Instance. See C.8.13.3.1.6 for a description and Defined Terms. Page 681

entry.name: Pulse Sequence Name
entry.description: Name of the pulse sequence for annotation purposes. Potentially vendor- specific name. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: MR Acquisition Type
entry.description: Identification of spatial data encoding scheme. Defined Terms: 1D 2D 3D Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Echo Pulse Sequence
entry.description: Echo category of pulse sequences. Enumerated Values: SPIN GRADIENT BOTH Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Multiple Spin Echo
entry.description: Multiple Spin Echo category of pulse sequence used to collect different lines in k-space for a single frame. Enumerated Values: YES NO Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Echo Pulse sequence (0018,9008) equals SPIN or BOTH. Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Echo Pulse sequence (0018,9008) equals SPIN or BOTH.

entry.name: Multi-planar Excitation
entry.description: Technique that simultaneously excites several volumes. Enumerated Values: YES

table.name: MR IMAGE FRAME TYPE MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: MR Image Frame Type Sequence
entry.description: Identifies the characteristics of this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Frame Type
entry.description: Type of Frame. A multi-valued attribute analogous to the Image Type (0008,0008). Enumerated Values and Defined Terms are the same as those for the four values of the Image Type (0008,0008) attribute, except that the value MIXED is not allowed. See C.8.16.1 and C.8.13.3.1.1.

table.name: MR TIMING AND RELATED PARAMETERS MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: MR Timing and Related Parameters Sequence
entry.description: Identifies the timing and safety information of this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Repetition Time
entry.description: The time in ms between two successive excitations of the same volume. Shall be 0 (zero) if there is a single excitation per volume. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Flip Angle
entry.description: Steady state angle in degrees to which the magnetic vector is flipped from the magnetic vector of the primary field. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Echo Train Length
entry.description: Number of lines in k-space acquired per excitation of the same volume regardless of the type of echo or the number of frames derived from them. See section C.8.12.5.2.1. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >RF Echo Train Length
entry.description: Number of RF echoes collected per RF shot (or excitation) per frame. A value of zero shall correspond to a pure gradient echo frame. Note that this value corresponds to the current frame. Several frames may be derived from the same shot. See section C.8.13.5.2.1. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Gradient Echo Train Length
entry.description: Number of gradient echoes collected per RF echo per shot (or excitation) per frame. A value of zero shall correspond to a pure RF echo frame. If RF Echo Train Length (0018,9240) is non zero and Gradient Echo Train Length is as well then only the central echo will be an RF Spin Echo, all others will be gradient echoes. See section C.8.13.5.2.1. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007)

entry.name: MR FOV/Geometry Sequence
entry.description: Identifies the geometry parameters of this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >In-plane Phase Encoding Direction
entry.description: The axes of the in-plane phase encoding with respect to the frame. Enumerated Values: COLUMN ROW OTHER Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >MR Acquisition Frequency Encoding Steps
entry.description: Number of Frequency Encoding steps (kx) acquired Page 693 Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >MR Acquisition Phase Encoding Steps in-plane
entry.description: Number of In-Plane Phase Encoding steps (ky) acquired Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >MR Acquisition Phase Encoding Steps out-of-plane
entry.description: Number of Out-of-Plane Phase Encoding steps (kz) acquired Required if MR Acquisition Type (0018,0023) equals 3D and Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Percent Sampling
entry.description: Fraction of acquisition matrix lines acquired, expressed as a percent. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Percent Phase Field of View
entry.description: Ratio of field of view dimension in phase direction to field of view dimension in frequency direction, expressed as a percent. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: MR Echo Sequence
entry.description: Identifies echo timing of this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Effective Echo Time
entry.description: The time in ms between the middle of the excitation pulse and the peak of the echo produced for kx=0. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: MR Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Identifies general acquisition parameters of this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Inversion Recovery
entry.description: Inversion Recovery preparatory sequence. Enumerated Values: YES NO Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Inversion Times
entry.description: Times in ms after the middle of inverting RF pulse to middle of excitation pulse to detect the amount of longitudinal magnetization. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Inversion Recovery (0018,9009) equals YES. Otherwise may be present if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is DERIVED and Inversion Recovery (0018,9009) equals YES.

entry.name: >Flow Compensation
entry.description: Flow Compensation. Defined Terms: ACCELERATION VELOCITY OTHER NONE Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Flow Compensation Direction
entry.description: Flow Compensation Direction. Enumerated Values: PHASE FREQUENCY SLICE_SELECT SLICE_AND_FREQ SLICE_FREQ_PHASE PHASE_AND_FREQ SLICE_AND_PHASE OTHER Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Flow Compensation (0018,9010) equals Page 695 other than NONE. Otherwise may be present if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is DERIVED and Flow Compensation (0018,9010) equals other than NONE.

entry.name: >Spoiling
entry.description: Spoiling. Enumerated Values: RF = RF spoiled GRADIENT = gradient spoiled RF_AND_GRADIENT NONE Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Echo Pulse Sequence (0018,9008) equals GRADIENT or BOTH. Otherwise may be present if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is DERIVED and Echo Pulse Sequence (0018,9008) equals GRADIENT or BOTH.

entry.name: >T2 Preparation
entry.description: T2 prepared Pulse Sequence. Enumerated Values: YES NO Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Spectrally Selected Excitation
entry.description: Spectrally Selected Excitation. Enumerated Values: WATER = water excitation FAT = fat excitation NONE Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Spatial Pre-saturation
entry.description: Spatial Pre-saturation. Defined Terms: SLAB NONE Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Partial Fourier
entry.description: Partial Fourier. Enumerated Values: YES NO Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Partial Fourier Direction
entry.description: Direction of Partial Fourier. Enumerated Values: PHASE

entry.name: MR Imaging Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Identifies sequence containing MR modifier Sequence Attributes. Only one item may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Magnetization Transfer
entry.description: Magnetization Transfer pulse sequence. Enumerated Values: ON_RESONANCE OFF_RESONANCE NONE Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Blood Signal Nulling
entry.description: Blood Signal Nulling ("Black Blood") preparatory pulse sequence. Enumerated Values: YES NO Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Tagging
entry.description: Tagging. Defined Terms: GRID LINE NONE Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Tag Spacing First Dimension
entry.description: Space between lines in mm. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Tagging (0018,9028) is GRID or LINE. Otherwise may be present if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is DERIVED and Tagging (0018,9028) is GRID or LINE.

entry.name: >Tag Spacing Second Dimension
entry.description: Space between the lines in mm in the other direction. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Tagging (0018,9028) is GRID. Otherwise may be present if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is DERIVED and Tagging (0018,9028) is GRID.

entry.name: >Tag Angle First Axis
entry.description: Angle of the tag lines relative to the rows axis (left to right) of the image, with a Page 699 range of 0-180 degrees. The angle is increasing in clockwise direction. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Tagging (0018,9028) is GRID or LINE. Otherwise may be present if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is DERIVED and Tagging (0018,9028) is GRID or LINE.

entry.name: >Tag Angle Second Axis
entry.description: Angle of the tag lines relative to the rows axis (left to right) of the image, with a range of 0-180 degrees. The angle is increasing in clockwise direction. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Tagging (0018,9028) is GRID. Otherwise may be present if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is DERIVED and Tagging (0018,9028) is GRID.

entry.name: >Tag Thickness
entry.description: Thickness of the line in mm. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Tagging (0018,9028) is GRID or LINE. Otherwise may be present if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is DERIVED and Tagging (0018,9028) is GRID or LINE.

entry.name: >Tagging Delay
entry.description: Delay time in ms of the beginning of the application of the tagging pattern relative to the last R-peak.

entry.name: >Transmitter Frequency
entry.description: Center transmitter frequency in MHz. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: > Pixel Bandwidth
entry.description: Reciprocal of the effective sampling period, in hertz per pixel. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: MR Receive Coil Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that provides information about each receive coil used. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Receive Coil Name
entry.description: Name of receive coil used. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Receive Coil Manufacturer Name
entry.description: Name of manufacturer of receive coil. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Receive Coil Type
entry.description: Type of receive coil used. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise. Defined Terms: BODY VOLUME = head, extremity, etc. SURFACE MULTICOIL

entry.name: >Quadrature Receive Coil
entry.description: Indicates whether the receive coil is quadrature. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise. Enumerated Values: YES = quadrature or circularly polarized NO = linear

entry.name: >Multi-Coil Definition Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that provides information regarding each element of a multi-coil. It should include attributes for all elements, whether used in the current acquisition or not. One or more Items shall be present. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Receive Coil Type (0018,9043) equals MULTICOIL. May be present otherwise only if Receive Coil Type (0018,9043) equals MULTICOIL.

entry.name: >>Multi-Coil Element Name
entry.description: Name of element of multi-coil. Page 701

entry.name: >>Multi-Coil Element Used
entry.description: Indicates whether the multi-coil element was used in the current acquisition. Enumerated Values: YES NO

entry.name: >Multi-Coil Configuration
entry.description: A textual description of the configuration of multi-coil elements which was used in the current acquisition.

entry.name: MR Transmit Coil Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that provides information about the transmit coil used. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Transmit Coil Name
entry.description: Name of transmit coil used. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Transmit Coil Manufacturer Name
entry.description: Name of manufacturer of transmit coil. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Transmit Coil Type
entry.description: Type of transmit coil used. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise. Defined Terms: BODY VOLUME = head, extremity, etc. SURFACE

entry.name: MR Diffusion Sequence
entry.description: Identifies the diffusion parameters of this frame. One Item shall be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Diffusion b-value
entry.description: Diffusion sensitization factor in sec/mm2. This is the actual b-value for original frames and those derived from frames with the same b-value, or the most representative b-value when derived from images with different b-values. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Diffusion Directionality
entry.description: Specifies whether diffusion conditions for the frame are directional, or isotropic with respect to direction. Defined Terms: DIRECTIONAL ISOTROPIC NONE = to be used when Frame Type (0008,9007) value 4 equals DIFFUSION_ANISO or Diffusion b-value (0018,9087) is 0 (zero). Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Diffusion Gradient Direction Sequence
entry.description: Sequence containing orientations of all diffusion sensitization gradients that were applied during the preparation phase for this frame. One or more Items may be present. Required if Diffusion Directionality (0018,9075) equals DIRECTIONAL

entry.name: >>Diffusion Gradient Orientation
entry.description: The direction cosines of the diffusion gradient vector with respect to the patient Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Diffusion Anisotropy Type
entry.description: Class of diffusion anisotropy calculation. Defined Terms: FRACTIONAL RELATIVE VOLUME_RATIO Page 703 Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) value 4 equals DIFFUSION_ANISO.

entry.name: MR Averages Sequence
entry.description: Identifies the averaging parameters of this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Number of Averages
entry.description: Maximum number of times any point in k- space is acquired. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: MR Spatial Saturation Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that provides the position of spatial saturation bands deposited as part of the pulse sequence. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Slab Thickness
entry.description: Thickness of slab in mm.

entry.name: >Slab Orientation
entry.description: The direction cosines of a normal vector perpendicular to the saturation plane with respect to the patient. See C.7.6.2.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Mid Slab Position
entry.description: The x, y, and z coordinates of the midpoint of the slab plane in mm with respect to the patient. See C.7.6.2.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: MR Velocity Encoding Sequence
entry.description: Identifies the velocity encoding of this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Velocity Encoding Direction
entry.description: The direction cosines of the velocity encoding vector with respect to the patient. See C.7.6.2.1.1 for further explanation. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Velocity Encoding Minimum Value
entry.description: Minimum velocity in cm/s. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Velocity Encoding Maximum Value
entry.description: Maximum velocity in cm/s. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Type of equipment that originally acquired the data used to create the images in this Series. Enumerated Values: MR See section C.7.3.1.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance to which the Series is related (e.g. a Modality or General-Purpose Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance). The Sequence shall

table.name: MR SPECTROSCOPY PULSE SEQUENCE MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Pulse Sequence Name
entry.description: Name of the pulse sequence for annotation purposes. Potentially vendor- specific name. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: MR Spectroscopy Acquisition Type
entry.description: Identification of data encoding scheme. Defined Terms: SINGLE_VOXEL ROW PLANE VOLUME Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Echo Pulse Sequence
entry.description: Echo category of pulse sequences. Enumerated Values: SPIN GRADIENT BOTH Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Multiple Spin Echo
entry.description: Multiple Spin Echo category of pulse sequence used to collect different lines in k-space for a single frame. Enumerated Values: YES NO Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Echo Pulse Sequence (0018,9008) equals SPIN or BOTH. Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Echo Pulse Sequence (0018,9008) equals SPIN or BOTH.

entry.name: Multi-planar Excitation
entry.description: Technique that simultaneously excites several volumes. Enumerated Values: YES

table.name: MR SPECTROSCOPY FRAME TYPE MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: MR Spectroscopy Frame Type Sequence
entry.description: Identifies sequence containing Frame Type Attributes. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

include.ref: >Include 'MR Spectroscopy Description Macro' Table C.8.107

entry.name: >Frame Type
entry.description: Spectroscopy data characteristics. See C.8.14.5.1.1. Page 715

entry.name: MR Spectroscopy FOV/Geometry Sequence
entry.description: Identifies the geometry parameters of this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Spectroscopy Acquisition Data Columns
entry.description: Number of data points in the columns direction. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Spectroscopy Acquisition Phase Rows
entry.description: Number of Phase Encoding Rows. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: > Spectroscopy Acquisition Phase Columns
entry.description: Number of Phase Encoding Columns. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Spectroscopy Acquisition Out-of- plane Phase Steps
entry.description: Number of out-of-plane Phase Encoding steps. Required if MR Spectroscopy Acquisition Type (0018,9200) equals PLANE and Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Percent Sampling
entry.description: Fraction of acquisition matrix lines acquired, expressed as a percent. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Percent Phase Field of View
entry.description: Ratio of field of view dimension in phase direction to field of view dimension in frequency direction, expressed as a percent. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Rows
entry.description: Number of voxels in the vertical direction in the frame.

entry.name: Columns
entry.description: Number of voxels in the horizontal direction in the frame.

entry.name: Data Point Rows
entry.description: Number of rows of data points in spectroscopic data.

entry.name: Data Point Columns
entry.description: Number of columns of data points in spectroscopic data.

entry.name: Data Representation
entry.description: Data representation of the data points. Each data point shall have the same representation. Enumerated Values: COMPLEX = Data is complex pair REAL = Data contains only real component IMAGINARY = Data contains only imaginary component MAGNITUDE = Magnitude data

entry.name: Signal Domain Columns
entry.description: Domain of represented signal in column direction. Enumerated Values: FREQUENCY TIME

entry.name: Signal Domain Rows
entry.description: Domain of represented signal in row direction. Enumerated Values: FREQUENCY TIME Required if Data Point Rows (0028,9001) has a value of more than 1.

entry.name: First Order Phase Correction Angle
entry.description: First Order Phase Correction Angle. Number of values is determined by Row Column Number of Frames. Required if First Order Phase Correction (0018,9198) equals YES

entry.name: Spectroscopy Data
entry.description: A data stream of the signal intensities that comprise the spectroscopic data. See C.8.14.4.1 for further explanation. Page 717

entry.name: Volumetric Properties
entry.description: Indication if geometric manipulations are possible with frames in the SOP Instance. See C.8.14.5.1.2 for a description and Enumerated Values.

entry.name: Volume Based Calculation Technique
entry.description: Method used for volume calculations with frames in the SOP Instance. See C.8.14.5.1.3 for a description and Defined Terms.

entry.name: Complex Image Component
entry.description: Representation of complex data of frames in the SOP Instance. See C.8.14.5.1.4 for a description and Defined Terms. Page 719

entry.name: Acquisition Contrast
entry.description: Indication of acquisition contrast used with frames in the SOP Instance. See C.8.14.5.1.5 for a description and Defined Terms.

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Type of equipment that originally acquired the data used to create the images in this Series. Enumerated Values: CT See section C.7.3.1.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance to which the Series is related (e.g. a Modality or General-Purpose Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance). The Sequence shall have one Item. Required if the Modality Performed Procedure Step SOP Class , General Purpose Performed Procedure Step SOP Class is supported.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

include.ref: Include Common CT/MR Image Description Macro' Table C.8-

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image characteristics. See sections C.8.16.1 and C.8.15.2.1.1.

table.name: CT IMAGE FRAME TYPE MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: CT Image Frame Type Sequence
entry.description: Identifies the characteristics of this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Frame Type
entry.description: Type of Frame. A multi-valued attribute analogous to the Image Type (0008,0008). Enumerated Values and Defined Terms are the same as those for the four values of the Image Type (0008,0008) attribute, except that the value MIXED is not allowed. See sections C.8.16.1 and C.8.15.2.1.1.1.

entry.name: CT Acquisition Type Sequence
entry.description: Contains the attributes defining the CT acquisition mode. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Acquisition Type
entry.description: Description of the method used during acquisition of this frame. See C.8.15.3.2.1 for Defined Terms. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Tube Angle
entry.description: The constant angle at which the x-ray source is located during acquisition. 0 degrees means that the source is located at the highest point of the gantry orbit. Degrees increase from 0 to positive 360 in a clockwise direction as viewed when facing the gantry where the table enters the gantry. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is

entry.name: CT Acquisition Details Sequence
entry.description: Contains the attributes defining the details of the acquisition. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Rotation Direction
entry.description: Direction of rotation of the source about the gantry, as viewed while facing the gantry where the table enters the gantry. Enumerated Values: CW = clockwise CC = counter clockwise Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is other than CONSTANT_ANGLE. Otherwise may be present if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is DERIVED and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is other than CONSTANT_ANGLE.

entry.name: >Revolution Time
entry.description: The time in seconds of a complete revolution of the source around the gantry orbit. This value is independent of the Reconstruction Angle (0018,9319) of the frame. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is other than CONSTANT_ANGLE. Otherwise may be present if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is DERIVED and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is other than CONSTANT_ANGLE.

entry.name: >Single Collimation Width
entry.description: The width of a single row of acquired data (in mm). Note: Adjacent physical detector rows may have been combined to form a single effective acquisition row. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: CT Table Dynamics Sequence
entry.description: Contains the attributes defining the movement of the CT table. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence. Page 731

entry.name: >Table Speed
entry.description: The distance in mm that the table moves in one second during the gathering of data that resulted in this frame. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is SPIRAL or CONSTANT_ANGLE. May be present otherwise if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is DERIVED and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is SPIRAL or CONSTANT_ANGLE.

entry.name: >Table Feed per Rotation
entry.description: Motion of the table (in mm) during a complete revolution of the source around the gantry orbit. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is SPIRAL. May be present otherwise if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is DERIVED and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is SPIRAL.

entry.name: >Spiral Pitch Factor
entry.description: Ratio of the Table Feed per Rotation (0018,9310) to the Total Collimation Width (0018,9307). See C.8.15.3.4.1 for further explanation and some examples. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is SPIRAL. May be present otherwise if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is DERIVED and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is SPIRAL.

entry.name: CT Position Sequence
entry.description: Contains the attributes defining the CT geometry. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Table Position
entry.description: Relative longitudinal position of acquisition location of this frame in mm from an implementation specific reference point. Shall be relative to the same reference point for all frames in this SOP Instance, but may be different from the reference point in other SOP Instances. Positions as the table moves into the gantry viewed from the front are more negative. Notes: 1. For contiguous slices reconstructed from multiple detectors one would expect different values for adjacent slices. 2. Lateral positioning or tilting or swiveling are not described. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Data Collection Center (Patient)
entry.description: The x, y, and z coordinates (in the patient coordinate system) in mm of the center of the region in which data were collected. See C.8.15.3.6.1. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Reconstruction Target Center (Patient)
entry.description: The x, y, and z coordinates (in the patient coordinate system) of the reconstruction center target point as used for reconstruction in mm. See C.8.15.3.6.1. Note: If the reconstructed image is not magnified or panned the value corresponds with the Data Collection Center (0018,9313) attribute. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise. Page 733

entry.name: CT Geometry Sequence
entry.description: Contains the attributes defining the CT geometry. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to detector center. See C.8.15.3.6.1. Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Image Receptor Distance (SID). Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Distance Source to Data Collection Center
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to data collection center. See C.8.15.3.6.1. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: CT Reconstruction Sequence
entry.description: Contains the attributes holding information about the reconstruction techniques used. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Reconstruction Algorithm
entry.description: Description of the algorithm used when reconstructing the image from the data acquired during the acquisition process. Defined Terms: Page 735 FILTER_BACK_PROJ ITERATIVE Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Convolution Kernel
entry.description: A label describing the convolution kernel or algorithm used to reconstruct the data. A single value shall be present. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Convolution Kernel Group
entry.description: A label describing the group that the Convolution Kernel (0018,1210) belongs. Defined Terms: BRAIN SOFT_TISSUE LUNG BONE CONSTANT_ANGLE Required if Convolution Kernel (0018,1210) is present. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Reconstruction Diameter
entry.description: The diameter in mm of the region from which data were used in creating the reconstruction of the image. Data may exist outside this region and portions of the patient may exist outside this region. See C.8.15.3.6.1. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Reconstruction Field of View (0018,9317) is not present. Otherwise may be present if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is DERIVED and Reconstruction Field of View (0018,9317) is not present.

entry.name: >Reconstruction Field of View
entry.description: The field of view width (x-dimension) followed by height (y-dimension) as used for reconstruction in mm. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Reconstruction Diameter (0018,1100) is not present. Otherwise may be present if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is DERIVED and Reconstruction Diameter (0018,1100) is not present.

entry.name: >Reconstruction Pixel Spacing
entry.description: Physical distance in the patient between the center of each reconstructed pixel, specified by a numeric pair ? adjacent row spacing (delimiter) adjacent column

entry.name: CT Exposure Sequence
entry.description: Contains the attributes defining exposure information. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Exposure Time in ms
entry.description: Duration of exposure for this frame in milliseconds. If Acquisition Type (0018,9302) equals SPIRAL the duration of exposure shall be weighted by the Spiral Pitch Factor (0018,9311). Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >X-ray Tube Current in mA
entry.description: Nominal X-ray tube current in milliamperes. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Page 737 Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Exposure in mAs
entry.description: The exposure expressed in milliampere seconds, for example calculated from exposure time and X-Ray tube current. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Exposure Modulation Type
entry.description: A label describing the type of exposure modulation used for the purpose of limiting the dose. Defined Terms: NONE Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Estimated Dose Saving
entry.description: A percent value of dose saving due to the use of Exposure Modulation Type (0018,9323). A negative percent value of dose savings reflects an increase of exposure. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Exposure Modulation Type (0018,9323) is not equal to NONE. Otherwise may be present if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is DERIVED and Exposure Modulation Type (0018,9323) is not equal to NONE.

entry.name: >CTDIvol
entry.description: Computed Tomography Dose Index (CTDIvol), in mGy according to IEC 60601- 2-44, Ed.2.1 (Clause 29.1.103.4), The Volume CTDIvol. It describes the average dose for this frame for the selected CT conditions of operation. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

table.name: CT X-RAY DETAILS SEQUENCE MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: CT X-ray Details Sequence
entry.description: Contains the attributes defining the x-ray information. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >KVP
entry.description: Peak kilo voltage output of the x-ray generator used. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Focal Spot(s)
entry.description: Used nominal size of the focal spot in mm. The attribute may only have one or two values, for devices with variable focal spot, small dimension followed by large dimension Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Filter Type
entry.description: Type of filter(s) inserted into the X-Ray beam. Defined Terms: WEDGE BUTTERFLY MULTIPLE FLAT SHAPED NONE Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Filter Material
entry.description: The X-Ray absorbing material used in the filter. May be multi-valued. Defined Terms: MOLYBDENUM ALUMINUM COPPER RHODIUM NIOBIUM EUROPIUM LEAD MIXED Note: MIXED may be used to indicate a filter type of complex composition for which listing the individual materials would be excessive or undesirable; it is not intended to mean "unknown". Page 739 Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and the value of Filter Type (0018,1160) is other than NONE. May be present otherwise.

table.name: CT PIXEL VALUE TRANSFORMATION MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Pixel Value Transformation Sequence
entry.description: Contains the attributes involved in the transformation of stored pixel values. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Rescale Intercept
entry.description: The value b in relationship between stored values (SV) and the output units. Output units = m*SV + b.

entry.name: >Rescale Slope
entry.description: m in the equation specified by Rescale Intercept (0028,1052).

entry.name: >Rescale Type
entry.description: Specifies the output units of Rescale Slope (0028,1053) and Rescale Intercept (0028,1052). See C.11.1.1.2 for further explanation. If Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 3 is not LOCALIZER, the value shall be HU (Hounsfield Units).

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Source equipment that produced the Ophthalmic Photography Series. Enumerated Value: OP

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics. See C.8.17.2.1.4 for specialization.

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this image.

entry.name: Samples per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (planes) in this image. Enumerated values: 1 or 3. See C.8.17.2.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Samples per Pixel Used
entry.description: The number of samples (planes) containing information. Enumerated value: 2. Required if different from Samples per Pixel (0028,0002). See section C.8.17.2.1.2

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. See section C.8.17.2.1.3

entry.name: Pixel Representation
entry.description: Data representation of the pixel samples. Enumerated value: 0

entry.name: Planar Configuration
entry.description: Indicates whether the pixel data are sent color-by-plane or color-by-pixel. Required if Samples per Pixel (0028,0002) has a value greater than 1. Enumerated value shall be 0 (color-by-pixel).

entry.name: Pixel Spacing
entry.description: Nominal physical distance at the focal plane (in the retina) between the center of each pixel, specified by a numeric pair - adjacent row spacing (delimiter) adjacent column spacing in mm. See 10.7.1.3 for further explanation of the value order. Note: These values are specified as nominal because the physical distance may vary across the field of the images and the lens correction is likely to be imperfect. Required when Acquisition Device Type Code Sequence (0022,0015) contains an item with the value (SRT, R- 1021A,"Fundus Camera"). May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Content Time
entry.description: The time the image pixel data creation started.

entry.name: Content Date
entry.description: The date the image pixel data creation started.

entry.name: Acquisition Datetime
entry.description: The date and time that the acquisition of data started. Note: The synchronization of this time with an external clock is specified in the synchronization Module in Acquisition Time Synchronized (0018,1800). Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Source Image Sequence
entry.description: A Sequence that identifies the set of Image SOP Class/Instance pairs of the Images that were used to derive this Image. Required if Image Type Value 1 is DERIVED. Zero or more items may be present in the sequence. See C.7.6.1.1.4 for further explanation.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8.1

entry.name: Acquisition Device Type Code Sequence
entry.description: Describes the type of acquisition device. A single item shall be present in the sequence. Baseline Context ID is 4202

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8.1

entry.name: Illumination Type Code Sequence
entry.description: Coded value for illumination. Zero or one item shall be present in the sequence. Baseline Context ID is 4203

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8.1

entry.name: Light Path Filter Type Stack Code Sequence
entry.description: Filters used in the light source path. Zero or more items may be present in the sequence. Baseline Context ID is 4204

entry.name: Light Path Filter Pass-Through Wavelength
entry.description: Nominal pass-through wavelength of light path filter in nm

entry.name: Light Path Filter Pass Band
entry.description: Pass band of light path filter in nm. This Attribute has two Values. The first is the shorter and the second the longer wavelength relative to the peak. The values are for the ? 3dB nominal (1/2 of peak) pass through intensity. One of the two Values may be zero length, in which case it is a cutoff filter.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8.1

entry.name: Image Path Filter Type Stack Code Sequence
entry.description: Describes stack of filters used in image path. Zero or more items may be present in the sequence. Baseline Context ID is 4204

entry.name: Image Path Filter Pass-Through Wavelength
entry.description: Nominal pass-through wavelength of image path filter in nm

entry.name: Image Path Filter Pass Band
entry.description: Pass band of image path filter in nm. This Attribute has two Values. The first is the shorter and the second the longer wavelength relative to the peak. The values are for the ? 3dB nominal (1/2 of peak) pass through intensity. One of the two Values may be zero length, in which case it is a cutoff filter

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8.1

entry.name: Lenses Code Sequence
entry.description: Lenses that were used during the image acquisition. Zero or more items may be present in the sequence. Baseline Context ID is 4205

entry.name: Detector Type
entry.description: Type of detector used for creating this image. Defined terms: CCD = Charge Coupled Devices CMOS = Complementary Metal Oxide Semiconductor

table.name: OPHTHALMIC PHOTOGRAPHY ACQUISITION PARAMETERS MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Patient Eye Movement Commanded
entry.description: Enumerated Values: YES NO

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8.1

entry.name: Patient Eye Movement Command Code Sequence
entry.description: Coded value for patient movement or orientation, which is the intent, and not necessarily the result, based on what the patient is capable of. Required if the value of Patient Eye Movement Commanded (0022,0005) is YES. A single item shall be present in this sequence. Baseline Context ID is 4201

entry.name: Refractive State Sequence
entry.description: The refractive state of the imaged eye at the time of acquisition. Zero or one Item shall be present. Absence of an item means the refractive state was not measured.

entry.name: > Spherical Lens Power
entry.description: Sphere value in diopters

entry.name: > Cylinder Lens Power
entry.description: Cylinder value in diopters

entry.name: > Cylinder Axis
entry.description: Axis value in degrees

entry.name: Emmetropic Magnification
entry.description: Emmetropic Magnification value (dimensionless). Zero length means the emmetropic magnification was not measured.

entry.name: Intra Ocular Pressure
entry.description: Value of pressure. Value in mmHg. Zero length means the pressure was not measured.

entry.name: Horizontal Field of View
entry.description: The horizontal field of view in degrees

entry.name: Pupil Dilated
entry.description: Enumerated Values: YES NO

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8.1

entry.name: Mydriatic Agent Code Sequence
entry.description: The agent administered to dilate the pupil. Required if the value of Pupil Dilated (0022,000D) is YES. Zero or more items may be present. Baseline Context ID is 4208

entry.name: Image Laterality
entry.description: Laterality of object imaged (as described in Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218)) examined. Enumerated Values: R = right eye L = left eye B = both left and right eye Shall be consistent with any laterality information contained in Primary Anatomic Structure Modifier Sequence (0008,2230), if present. Note: Laterality (0020,0060) is a Series level Attribute and must be the same for all Images in the Series. Since most Ophthalmic Photographic Image studies contain images of both eyes, the series level attribute will rarely be present.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8.1
Include 'General Anatomy Mandatory Macro' Table 10-5

entry.name: Relative Image Position Code Sequence
entry.description: The position of this image on the retina (as defined by a specified nomenclature; the nomenclature is implicit in the code used). Baseline Context ID 4207 Defined Context ID 4209 for Anatomic Region Sequence

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Source equipment that produced the Stereometric Series. Enumerated Value: SMR

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Type of equipment that originally acquired the data used to create the images in this Series. Enumerated Values: XA RF See section C.7.3.1.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Series Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this Series.

entry.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance to which the Series is related (e.g. a Modality or General-Purpose Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance). Only a single Item is permitted in this sequence. Required if the Modality Performed Procedure Step SOP Class, General Purpose Performed Procedure Step SOP Class is supported.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics. See C.8.19.2.1.1 for specialization.

entry.name: Plane Identification
entry.description: Identification of the plane used to acquire this image. Page 757 Defined Terms: MONOPLANE PLANE A PLANE B Notes: 1. MONOPLANE may only be used for a single plane system 2. PLANE A and PLANE B must be used for two plane systems, independent if the acquisition is single plane or biplane. 3. The value has to be in accordance with Image Type (0008,0008) value 3. If this value is SINGLE PLANE all three Defined Term are applicable. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 is not equal to UNDEFINED.

entry.name: Acquisition Number
entry.description: A number identifying the single continuous gathering of data over a period of time that resulted in this image.

entry.name: Acquisition Datetime
entry.description: The date and time that the acquisition of data that resulted in this image started. Note: The synchronization of this time with an external clock is specified in the Synchronization Module in Acquisition Time Synchronized (0018,1800).

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated. Enumerated Values: 8 and 16.

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits stored. Enumerated Values: 8 to 16. See C.8.19.2.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: High Bit
entry.description: Most significant bit for pixel sample data. Each sample shall have the same high bit. Shall be one less than the value in Bits Stored (0028,0101).

entry.name: Samples per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (color planes) in this image shall have a value of 1.

entry.name: Pixel Representation
entry.description: Data representation of the pixel samples. Shall have the value: 0000H = Unsigned Integer.

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. Enumerated Values: MONOCHROME1 MONOCHROME2

entry.name: KVP
entry.description: Average of the peak kilo voltage outputs of the X-Ray generator used for all frames.

entry.name: Radiation Setting
entry.description: Identify the general level of X-Ray dose exposure.
