Enumerated values are: SC = low dose exposure generally corresponding to fluoroscopic settings (e.g. preparation for diagnostic quality image acquisition); GR = high dose for diagnostic quality image acquisition (also called digital spot or cine);

entry.name: X-Ray Tube Current in mA
entry.description: Average of the nominal X-ray tube currents in milliamperes for all frames. Required if Exposure in mAs (0018,9332) is not present. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Exposure Time in ms
entry.description: Duration of X-Ray exposure in milliseconds. See C.8.7.2.1.1. Required if Exposure in mAs (0018,9332) is not present. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Exposure in mAs
entry.description: The exposure expressed in milliampereseconds, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-ray Tube Current. Required if either Exposure Time in ms (0018,9328) or X-Ray Tube Current in mA (0018,9330) are not present. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Average Pulse Width
entry.description: Average width of X-Ray pulse in msec.

entry.name: Acquisition Duration
entry.description: The time in seconds needed for the complete acquisition. Page 763 See C.7.6.16.2.2.1 for further explanation

entry.name: Radiation Mode
entry.description: Specifies X-Ray radiation mode. Defined Terms: CONTINUOUS PULSED

entry.name: Focal Spot
entry.description: Nominal focal spot size in mm used to acquire this image.

entry.name: Anode Target Material
entry.description: The primary material in the anode of the X- Ray source. Defined Terms: TUNGSTEN MOLYBDENUM RHODIUM

entry.name: Rectification Type
entry.description: Type of rectification used in the X-Ray generator. Defined Terms: SINGLE PHASE THREE PHASE CONST POTENTIAL

entry.name: X-Ray Receptor Type
entry.description: Identifies with type of X-ray receptor is used. Enumerated Values: IMG_INTENSIFIER DIGITAL_DETECTOR

entry.name: Imager Pixel Spacing
entry.description: Physical distance measured at the receptor plane of the detector between the centers of each pixel specified by a numeric pair ? row spacing value (delimiter) column spacing value in mm. See 10.7.1.3 for further explanation of the value order. Note: These values are the actual pixel spacing distances of the stored pixel values of an image.

entry.name: Distance Receptor Plane to Detector Housing
entry.description: Distance in mm between the receptor plane and the detector housing. The direction of the distance is positive from receptor plane to X-Ray source. Note: 1. A negative value is allowed in the case of an image intensifier the receptor plane can be a virtual plane located outside the detector housing depending the magnification factor of the intensifier. A negative value is not applicable for the digital detector. 2. Used to calculate the pixel size of the plane in the patient when markers are used, and they are placed on the detector housing.

entry.name: Intensifier Size
entry.description: Physical diameter of the maximum active area X-Ray intensifier in mm. Note: This attribute does not specify the field of view. The attribute Field of View Dimension(s) in Float (0018,9461) is intended for this value.

entry.name: Intensifier Active Shape
entry.description: Shape of the active area used for acquiring this image. Enumerated Value: Page 765 RECTANGLE ROUND HEXAGONAL Note: This may be different from the Field of View Shape (0018,1147), and should not be assumed to describe the stored image.

entry.name: Intensifier Active Dimension(s)
entry.description: Dimensions in mm of the active area used for acquiring this image. If Intensifier Active Shape (0018,9427) is: RECTANGLE: row dimension followed by column. ROUND: diameter. HEXAGONAL: diameter of the circle circumscribing the hexagon. Note: This may be different from the Field of View Dimension(s) in Float (0018,9461), and should not be assumed to describe the stored image.

entry.name: XA/XRF Frame Characteristics Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that describes general characteristics of this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Derivation Description
entry.description: A text description of how this frame was derived. See C.8.7.1.1.5 for further explanation.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1

entry.name: >Derivation Code Sequence
entry.description: A coded description of how this frame was derived. See C.7.6.1.1.3 for further explanation. Defined Context ID is 7203.

entry.name: >Acquisition Device Processing Description
entry.description: Indicates any visual processing performed on the frame prior to exchange. See Section C.8.7.1.1.3.

entry.name: >Acquisition Device Processing Code
entry.description: Code representing the device-specific processing associated with the frame (e.g. Organ Filtering code) Note: This Code is manufacturer specific but provides useful annotation information to the knowledgeable observer.

table.name: X-RAY FIELD OF VIEW MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Field of View Sequence
entry.description: Sequence containing the field of view for this frame. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Field of View Shape
entry.description: Shape of the Field of View, that is the image pixels stored in Pixel Data (7FE0,0010). Enumerated Values: RECTANGLE ROUND HEXAGONAL Page 767

entry.name: >Field of View Dimension(s) in Float
entry.description: Dimensions in mm of the Field of View, that is the image pixels stored in Pixel Data (7FE0,0010). If Field of View Shape (0018,1147) is: RECTANGLE: row dimension followed by column. ROUND: diameter. HEXAGONAL: diameter of the circle circumscribing the hexagon.

entry.name: >Field of View Origin
entry.description: Offset of the TLHC of a rectangle circumscribing the Field of View, i.e., the image pixels stored in Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) before rotation or flipping, from the TLHC of the physical detector area measured in physical detector pixels as a row offset followed by a column offset. See C.8.11.4.1.1 for further explanation. Required if X-Ray Receptor Type (0018,9420) is present and equals DIGITAL_DETECTOR.

entry.name: >Field of View Rotation
entry.description: Clockwise rotation in degrees of Field of View, i.e., the image pixels stored in Pixel Data (7FE0,0010), relative to the physical detector. Enumerated Values: 0, 90, 180, 270 See C.8.11.4.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Field of View Horizontal Flip
entry.description: Whether or not a horizontal flip has been applied to the Field of View, i.e., the image pixels stored in Pixel Data (7FE0,0010), after rotation relative to the physical detector as described in Field of View Rotation (0018,7032). Enumerated Values: NO YES See C.8.11.4.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Field of View Description
entry.description: Manufacturer defined description of the field of view selected during acquisition.

table.name: X-RAY EXPOSURE CONTROL SENSING REGIONS MACRO ATTRIBUTES
XA/XRF FRAME PIXEL DATA PROPERTIES MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Frame Pixel Data Properties Sequence
entry.description: Sequence containing the pixel data properties for this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Pixel Intensity Relationship
entry.description: The relationship between the Pixel and the X-Ray beam intensity. See C.8.19.6.4.1.

entry.name: >Pixel Intensity Relationship Sign
entry.description: The sign of the relationship between the Pixel sample values stored in Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) and the X-Ray beam intensity. Enumerated Values: 1 = Lower pixel values correspond to less X-Ray beam intensity -1 = Higher pixel values correspond to less X-Ray beam intensity See C.8.11.3.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Geometrical Properties
entry.description: Geometrical characteristics of the pixel data to indicate whether pixel spacing is uniform for all pixels or not.

table.name: X-RAY FRAME DETECTOR PARAMETERS MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Frame Detector Parameters Sequence
entry.description: Sequence containing the detector properties for this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Detector Active Time
entry.description: Time in mSec that the detector is active during acquisition of this image. Note: This activation window overlaps the time of the X-Ray exposure as defined by Exposure Time in ms (0018,9328) and Detector Activation Offset From Exposure (0018,7016).

entry.name: >Detector Activation Offset From Exposure
entry.description: Offset time in mSec that the detector becomes active after the X-Ray beam is turned on during acquisition of this image. May be negative.

table.name: X-RAY CALIBRATION DEVICE USAGE MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Calibration Sequence
entry.description: Sequence containing the calibration flag for this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Calibration Image
entry.description: Indicates whether a reference object (phantom) of known size is present in the frame and was used for calibration. Enumerated Values: YES NO Note: Device is identified using the Device module. See C.7.6.12.

entry.name: Object Thickness Sequence
entry.description: Sequence containing object thickness for this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Calculated Anatomy Thickness
entry.description: The physical thickness in mm of the anatomic region of interest as specified in the Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218) in the direction of the center of the beam. Note: The value takes in account the position relative to object and the X-Ray source ? detector axis.

entry.name: Frame Acquisition Sequence
entry.description: Sequence containing the acquisition parameters for this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >KVP
entry.description: Exact peak kilo voltage output of the X- Ray generator used for this frame.

entry.name: >X-Ray Tube Current in mA
entry.description: Exact Nominal X-ray tube current in milliamperes applied during the Acquisition Duration (0018,9220) for this frame.

table.name: X-RAY PROJECTION PIXEL CALIBRATION MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Projection Pixel Calibration Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that describes the geometrical position of the patient relative to the equipment. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Distance Object to Table Top
entry.description: Distance between the anatomic region of interest of observation and table top in mm. Notes: 1.This value is always positive, the object is assumed to be above the table. 2.The value of this attribute is depending on the patient position on the tabletop (supine, left or right decubitus, etc.)

entry.name: >Object Pixel Spacing in Center of Beam
entry.description: Physical distance within the anatomic region of interest in the center of the beam and perpendicular to the beam between the center of each pixel, specified by a numeric pair adjacent row spacing (delimiter) adjacent column spacing in mm. See C.8.19.6.9.2. See 10.7.1.3 for further explanation of the value order. Required if Distance Object to Table Top (0018,9403) is not empty. Note: This value is provided besides the values that are the input parameters of the calibration algorithm.

entry.name: >Table Height
entry.description: The distance of the top of the patient table to the center of rotation of the source (i.e. the isocenter) in mm. A positive value indicates that the tabletop is below the isocenter. Note: All the distances are measured perpendicular to the Table Top plane. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL, may be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Beam Angle
entry.description: The equipment related angle in degrees of the X-Ray beam relative to the perpendicular to the tabletop plane. An angle from 0 to +90 degrees indicates

entry.name: Positioner Position Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that describes the geometrical position of the positioner. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Positioner Primary Angle
entry.description: Position of the X-Ray Image Intensifier about the patient from the RAO to LAO direction where movement from RAO to vertical is positive. See C.8.7.5.1.2. Required if Positioner Type (0018,1508) equals CARM.

entry.name: >Positioner Secondary Angle
entry.description: Position of the X-Ray Image Intensifier about the patient from the CAU to CRA direction where movement from CAU to vertical is positive. See C.8.7.5.1.2 Required if Positioner Type (0018,1508) equals CARM.

entry.name: >Column Angulation (Patient)
entry.description: Angle of the X-Ray beam in degree relative to an orthogonal axis to the detector plane. Positive values indicate that the tilt is towards the head of the patient. Notes: 1. The detector plane is assumed to be parallel to the table plane 2. This attribute differentiates form the attribute Column Angulation (0018,1450) by using the patient based coordinate system instead of the equipment based coordinate system. Required if Positioner Type (0018,1508) equals COLUMN. Page 777

entry.name: Table Position Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that describes the geometrical position of the table top. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Table Top Vertical Position
entry.description: Table Top Vertical position with respect to an arbitrary chosen reference by the equipment in (mm). Table motion downwards is positive

entry.name: >Table Top Longitudinal Position
entry.description: Table Top Longitudinal position with respect to an arbitrary chosen reference by the equipment in (mm). Table motion towards LAO is positive assuming that the patient is positioned supine and its head is in normal position.

entry.name: >Table Top Lateral Position
entry.description: Table Top Lateral position with respect to an arbitrary chosen reference by the equipment in (mm). Table motion towards CRA is positive assuming that the patient is positioned supine and its head is in normal position.

entry.name: >Table Horizontal Rotation Angle
entry.description: Rotation of the table in the horizontal plane (clockwise when looking from above the table).

entry.name: >Table Head Tilt Angle
entry.description: Angle of the head-feet axis of the table in degrees relative to the horizontal plane. Positive values indicate that the head of the table is upwards.

entry.name: >Table Cradle Tilt Angle
entry.description: Angle of the left-right axis of the table in degrees relative to the horizontal plane. Positive values indicate that the left of the table is upwards.

entry.name: Collimator Shape Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that describes the collimator shape. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Collimator Shape
entry.description: Shape(s) of the collimator. Enumerated Values: RECTANGULAR CIRCULAR POLYGONAL This multi-valued Attribute shall contain at most one of each Enumerated Value.

entry.name: >Collimator Left Vertical Edge
entry.description: Required if Collimator Shape (0018,1700) is RECTANGULAR. Location of the left edge of the rectangular collimator expressed as effective pixel column. See C.8.7.3.1.1 and C.8.19.6.12.1.

entry.name: >Collimator Right Vertical Edge
entry.description: Required if Collimator Shape (0018,1700) is RECTANGULAR. Location of the right Page 779 edge of the rectangular collimator expressed as effective pixel column. See C.8.7.3.1.1 and C.8.19.6.12.1.

entry.name: >Collimator Upper Horizontal Edge
entry.description: Required if Collimator Shape (0018,1700) is RECTANGULAR. Location of the upper edge of the rectangular collimator expressed as effective pixel row. See C.8.7.3.1.1 and C.8.19.6.12.1.

entry.name: >Collimator Lower Horizontal Edge
entry.description: Required if Collimator Shape (0018,1700) is RECTANGULAR. Location of the lower edge of the rectangular collimator expressed as effective pixel row. See C.8.7.3.1.1 and C.8.19.6.12.1.

entry.name: >Center of Circular Collimator
entry.description: Required if Collimator Shape (0018,1700) is CIRCULAR. Location of the center of the circular collimator expressed as effective pixel row and column. See C.8.7.3.1.1 and C.8.19.6.12.1.

entry.name: >Radius of Circular Collimator
entry.description: Required if Collimator Shape (0018,1700) is CIRCULAR. Radius of the circular collimator expressed as effective number of pixels along the row direction. See C.8.7.3.1.1 and C.8.19.6.12.1.

entry.name: >Vertices of the Polygonal Collimator
entry.description: Required if Collimator Shape (0018,1700) is POLYGONAL. Multiple Values where the first set of two values are: row of the origin vertex; column of the origin vertex. Two or more pairs of values follow and are the effective pixel row and column coordinates of the other vertices of the polygon collimator. Polygon collimators are implicitly closed from the last vertex to the origin vertex and all edges shall be non-intersecting except at the vertices. See C.8.19.6.12.1.

table.name: X-RAY ISOCENTER REFERENCE SYSTEM MACRO ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Isocenter Reference System Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that describes the Isocenter Reference Coordinate System (O, X, Y, Z). Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Positioner Isocenter Primary Angle
entry.description: Position of the X-Ray center beam in the isocenter reference system in the X direction (deg). See C.8.19.6.13.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Positioner Isocenter Secondary Angle
entry.description: Position of the X-Ray center beam in the isocenter reference system in the Z direction (deg). See C.8.19.6.13.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Positioner Isocenter Detector Rotation Angle
entry.description: Rotation of the X-Ray detector plane (deg). See C.8.19.6.13.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Table X Position to Isocenter
entry.description: X position of the Table Reference Point with respect to the Isocenter (mm). See C.8.19.6.13.1.3 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Table Y Position to Isocenter
entry.description: Y position of the Table Reference Point with respect to the Isocenter (mm). See C.8.19.6.13.1.3 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Table Z Position to Isocenter
entry.description: Z position of the Table Reference Point with respect to the Isocenter (mm). See C.8.19.6.13.1.3 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Table Horizontal Rotation Angle
entry.description: Rotation of the table in the horizontal plane. See C.8.19.6.13.1.3 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Table Head Tilt Angle
entry.description: Angle of the head-feet axis of the table in degrees relative to the horizontal plane. See C.8.19.6.13.1.3 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Table Cradle Tilt Angle
entry.description: Angle of the left-right axis of the table in Page 781 degrees relative to the horizontal plane. See C.8.19.6.13.1.3 for further explanation.

entry.name: X-Ray Geometry Sequence
entry.description: Sequence containing the geometric properties for this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Distance Source to Isocenter
entry.description: Distance from source to isocenter in mm.

entry.name: >Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance from source to receptor plane perpendicular to the receptor plane in mm. Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Image Receptor Distance (SID).

entry.name: Preferred Playback Sequencing
entry.description: Describes the preferred playback sequencing for a multi-frame image. Enumerated Values: 0 = Looping (1,2...n,1,2,...n,1,2,....n,...) 1 = Sweeping (1,2,...n,n -1,...2,1,2,...n,...)

entry.name: Frame Display Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies the display frame

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Modality Type Enumerated Value: SEG

entry.name: Series Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this Series

entry.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance to which the Series is related (e.g. a Modality or General-Purpose Performed Procedure Step SOP). Only a single Item is permitted in this sequence. Required if the SOP Instance was created in a workflow managed with the Modality Performed Procedure Step SOP Class or General Purpose Performed Procedure Step SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

include.ref: Include Content Identification Macro Table 10-12

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Value 1 shall be DERIVED. Value 2 shall be PRIMARY. No other values shall be present.

entry.name: Samples Per Pixel
entry.description: Enumerated Values: 1

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Enumerated Values: MONOCHROME2

entry.name: Pixel Representation
entry.description: Enumerated Values: 0

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: If Segmentation Type (0062,0001) is BINARY, shall be 1. Otherwise it shall be 8. See Section C.8.20.2.1.

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: If Segmentation Type (0062,0001) is BINARY, shall be 1. Otherwise it shall be 8. See Section C.8.20.2.1.

entry.name: Segment Identification Sequence
entry.description: Identifies the characteristics of this frame. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced Segment Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the segment described in the Segment Sequence (0062,0002) by reference to the Segment Number (0062,0004). Referenced Segment Number (0062,000B) shall not be multi-valued.

entry.name: Overlay Rows
entry.description: Number of Rows in Overlay.

entry.name: Overlay Columns
entry.description: Number of Columns in Overlay.

entry.name: Overlay Type
entry.description: Indicates whether this overlay represents a region of interest or other graphics. Enumerated Values: G = Graphics R = ROI.

entry.name: Overlay Origin
entry.description: Location of first overlay point with respect to pixels in the image, given as row\column. The upper left pixel of the image has the coordinate 1\1. Column values greater than 1 indicate the overlay plane origin is to the right of the image origin. Row values greater than 1 indicate the overlay plane origin is below the image origin. Values less than 1 indicate the overlay plane origin is above or to the left of the image origin. Note: Values of 0\0 indicate that the overlay pixels start 1 row above and one column to the left of the image pixels. Page 795

entry.name: Overlay Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of Bits Allocated in the Overlay. Tthe value of this Attribute shall be 1. Note: Formerly the standard described embedding the overlay data in the Image Pixel Data (7FE0,0010), in which case the value of this Attribute was required to be the same as Bits Allocated (0028,0100). This usage has been retired. See PS 3.3 2004.

entry.name: Overlay Bit Position
entry.description: The value of this Attribute shall be 0. Note: Formerly the standard described embedding the overlay data in the Image Pixel Data (7FE0,0010), in which case the value of this Attribute specified the bit in which the overlay was stored. This usage has been retired. See PS 3.3 2004.

entry.name: Overlay Data
entry.description: Overlay pixel data. The order of pixels sent for each overlay is left to right, top to bottom, i.e., the upper left pixel is sent first followed by the remainder of the first row , followed by the first pixel of the 2nd row, then the remainder of the 2nd row and so on. Overlay data shall be contained in this Attribute . See C.9.2.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Overlay Description
entry.description: User-defined comments about the overlay.

entry.name: Overlay Subtype
entry.description: Defined term which identifies the intended purpose of the Overlay Type. See C.9.2.1.3 for further explanation.

entry.name: Overlay Label
entry.description: A user defined text string which may be used to label or name this overlay.

entry.name: ROI Area
entry.description: Number of pixels in ROI area. See C.9.2.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: ROI Mean
entry.description: ROI Mean. See C.9.2.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: ROI Standard Deviation
entry.description: ROI standard deviation. See C.9.2.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Number of Frames in Overlay
entry.description: Number of Frames in Overlay. Required if Overlay data contains multiple frames.

entry.name: Image Frame Origin
entry.description: Frame number of Multi-frame Image to which this overlay applies; frames are numbered from 1.

entry.name: Displayed Area Selection Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of Items each of which describes the displayed area selection for a group of images or frames. Sufficient Items shall be present to describe every image and frame listed in the Presentation State Module. One or more Items shall be present.

include.ref: >>Include `Image SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table 10-3

entry.name: >Referenced Image Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items where each Item provides reference to a selected set of Image SOP Class/SOP Instance pairs that are defined in the Presentation State Module. Required if a sequence item is present, and if the displayed area selection in this Item does not apply to all the images listed in the Presentation State Module.

entry.name: >Displayed Area Top Left Hand Corner
entry.description: The top left (after spatial transformation) pixel in the referenced image to be displayed, given as column\row. Column is the horizontal (before spatial transformation) offset (X) and row is the vertical (before spatial transformation) offset (Y) relative to the origin of the pixel data before spatial transformation, which is 1\1. See Figure C.10.4-1.

entry.name: >Displayed Area Bottom Right Hand Corner
entry.description: The bottom right (after spatial transformation) pixel in the referenced image to be displayed, given as column\row. Column is the horizontal (before spatial transformation) offset (X) and row is the vertical (before spatial transformation) offset (Y) relative to the origin of the pixel data before spatial transformation, which is 1\1. See Figure C.10.4-1.

entry.name: >Presentation Size Mode
entry.description: Manner of selection of display size. Enumerated Values: SCALE TO FIT TRUE SIZE MAGNIFY See C.10.4 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Presentation Pixel Spacing
entry.description: Physical distance between the center of each pixel in the referenced image (before spatial transformation), specified by a numeric pair ? adjacent row spacing (delimiter) adjacent column spacing in mm. See 10.7.1.3 for further explanation of the Page 801 value order. Notes: 1. This value may be different from Pixel Spacing (0028,0030) or Imager Pixel Spacing (0018,1164) specified in the referenced image, which are ignored, since some form of calibration may have been performed (for example by reference to an object of known size in the image). 2. If the row and column spacing are different, then the pixel aspect ratio of the image is not 1:1. Required if Presentation Size Mode (0070,0100) is TRUE SIZE, in which case the values will correspond to the physical distance between the center of each pixel on the display device. May be present if Presentation Size Mode (0070,0100) is SCALE TO FIT or MAGNIFY, in which case the values are used to compute the aspect ratio of the image pixels.

entry.name: >Presentation Pixel Aspect Ratio
entry.description: Ratio of the vertical size and the horizontal size of the pixels in the referenced image, to be used to display the referenced image, specified by a pair of integer values where the first value is the vertical pixel size and the second value is the horizontal pixel size. See C.7.6.3.1.7. Required if Presentation Pixel Spacing (0070,0101) is not present. Notes: 1. This value may be different from the aspect ratio specified by Pixel Aspect Ratio (0028,0034) in the referenced image, or implied by the values of Pixel Spacing (0028,0030) or Imager Pixel Spacing (0018,1164) specified in the referenced image, which are ignored. 2. This value must be specified even if the aspect ratio is 1:1.

entry.name: >Presentation Pixel Magnification Ratio
entry.description: Ratio of displayed pixels to source pixels, specified in one dimension. Required if Presentation Size Mode (0070,0100) is MAGNIFY. Notes: 1. A value of 1.0 would imply that one pixel in the referenced image would be displayed as one pixel on the display (i.e. it would not be interpolated if the aspect ratio of the image pixels is 1:1). 2. A value of 2.0 would imply that one pixel in the referenced image

entry.name: Graphic Annotation Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of Items each of which represents a group of annotations composed of graphics or text or both. One or more Items shall be present.

include.ref: >>Include `Image SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table 10-3

entry.name: >Referenced Image Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items where each Item provides reference to a selected set of Image SOP Class/SOP Instance pairs that are defined in the Presentation State Module. Required if a sequence item is present, and if graphic annotations in this Item do not apply to all the images listed in the Presentation State Module.

entry.name: >Graphic Layer
entry.description: The layer defined in the Graphic Layer Module C.10.7 in which the graphics or text is to be rendered.

entry.name: >Text Object Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that describes a text annotation. One or more Items may be present. Either one or both of Text Object Sequence (0070,0008) or Graphic Object Sequence (0070,0009) are required if the Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >>Bounding Box Annotation Units
entry.description: Units of measure for the axes of the text bounding box. Defines whether or not the annotation is Image or Displayed Area relative. Both dimensions shall have the same units. Enumerated Values: PIXEL = Image relative position specified with sub-pixel resolution such that the origin at the Top Left Hand Corner (TLHC) of the TLHC pixel is 0.0\0.0, the Bottom Right Hand Corner (BRHC) of the TLHC pixel is 1.0\1.0, and the BRHC of the BRHC pixel is Columns\Rows (see figure C.10.5-1). The values must be within the Page 805 range 0\0 to Columns\Rows. DISPLAY = Fraction of Specified Displayed Area where 0.0\0.0 is the TLHC and 1.0\1.0 is the BRHC. The values must be within the range 0.0 to 1.0. Required if Bounding Box Top Left Hand Corner (0070,0010) or Bounding Box Bottom Right Hand Corner (0070,0011) is present.

entry.name: >>Anchor Point Annotation Units
entry.description: Units of measure for the axes of the text anchor point annotation. Enumerated Values for Anchor Point Annotation Units (0070,0004) are the same as for Bounding Box Annotation Units (0070,0003). Required if Anchor Point (0070,0014) is present.

entry.name: >>Unformatted Text Value
entry.description: Text data which is unformatted and whose manner of display within the defined bounding box or relative to the specified anchor point is implementation dependent. See C.10.5.1.1. The text value may contain spaces, as well as multiple lines separated by either LF, CR, CR LF or LF CR, but otherwise no format control characters (such as horizontal or vertical tab and form feed) shall be present, even if permitted by the Value Representation of ST. The text shall be interpreted as specified by Specific Character Set (0008,0005) if present in the SOP Common Module. Note: The text may contain single or multi-byte characters and use code extension techniques as described in PS 3.5 if permitted by the values of Specific Character Set (0008,0005).

entry.name: >>Bounding Box Top Left Hand Corner
entry.description: Location of the Top Left Hand Corner (TLHC) of the bounding box in which Unformatted Text Value (0070,0006) is to be displayed, in Bounding Box Annotation Units (0070,0003), given as column\row. Column is the horizontal offset and row is the vertical offset. Required if Anchor Point (0070,0014) is not present.

entry.name: >>Bounding Box Bottom Right Hand Corner
entry.description: Location of the Bottom Right Hand Corner (BRHC) of the bounding box in which Unformatted Text Value (0070,0006) is to be displayed, in Bounding Box Annotation Units (0070,0003), given as column\row.

entry.name: Image Rotation
entry.description: How far to rotate the image clockwise in degrees, before any Image Horizontal Flip (0070,0041) is applied. Enumerated Values: 0, 90,180,270 Notes: Negative values are not permitted since the Value Representation is unsigned.

entry.name: Image Horizontal Flip
entry.description: Whether or not to flip the image horizontally after any Image Rotation has been applied such that the left side of the image becomes the right side.

entry.name: Graphic Layer Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of Items each of which represents a single layer in which overlays, curves, graphics or text may be rendered. An Item is required for each layer referenced from the Graphic Annotation Module or the Overlay Activation Module.

entry.name: >Graphic Layer
entry.description: A string which identifies the layer. Note: This identifier may be used by other Attributes within the same presentation state instance to reference this layer. There is no requirement for the same identifiers to be used in different presentation states, and there is no mechanism for referencing layers in other presentation states. That is, a UID is not required.

entry.name: >Graphic Layer Order
entry.description: An integer indicating the order in which it is recommended that the layer be rendered, if the display is capable of distinguishing. Lower numbered layers are to be rendered first.

entry.name: >Graphic Layer Recommended Display Grayscale Value
entry.description: A default single gray unsigned value in which it is recommended that the layer be rendered on a monochrome display. The units are specified in P-Values from a minimum of 0000H (black) up to a maximum of FFFFH (white). Note: The maximum P-Value for this Attribute may be different from the maximum P-Value from the output of the Presentation LUT, which may be less than 16 bits in depth.

entry.name: >Graphic Layer Recommended Display CIELab Value
entry.description: A default color triplet value in which it is recommended that the layer be rendered on a color display. The units are specified in PCS-Values, and the value is encoded as CIELab. See C.10.7.1.1.

entry.name: >Graphic Layer Description
entry.description: A free text description of the contents of this layer.

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this Waveform.

entry.name: Content Date
entry.description: The date the Waveform data was created.

entry.name: Content Time
entry.description: The time the Waveform data was created.

entry.name: Acquisition Datetime
entry.description: The date and time that the acquisition of data that resulted in this waveform started; the reference timestamp for the Multiplex Group Time Offset (0018,1068) for a waveform multiplex group Note: The synchronization of this time with an external clock is specified in the Synchronization Module in Acquisition Time Synchronized (0018,1800).

entry.name: Referenced Instance Sequence
entry.description: A sequence which provides reference to a set of SOP Class/Instance pairs significantly related to this Waveform. One or more Items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: Waveform Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of one or more Items, each representing one waveform multiplex group. Ordering of Items in this Sequence is significant for external reference to specific multiplex groups.

entry.name: > Multiplex Group Time Offset
entry.description: Offset time in milliseconds from a reference time (see C.10.9.1.1). Required if Acquisition Time Synchronized (0018,1800) value is Y; may be present otherwise.

entry.name: > Trigger Time Offset
entry.description: Offset time in milliseconds from a synchronization trigger to the first sample of a waveform multiplex group. May be positive or negative. Required if waveform acquisition is synchronized to a trigger.

entry.name: > Trigger Sample Position
entry.description: Sample number whose time corresponds to a synchronization trigger (see C.10.9.1.2).

entry.name: > Waveform Originality
entry.description: See C.10.9.1.3. Enumerated values: ORIGINAL DERIVED

entry.name: > Number of Waveform
entry.description: Number of channels for this multiplex group.

include.ref: Include Modality LUT Macro Table C.11-1b
Include VOI LUT Macro Table C.11-2b

entry.name: Histogram Sequence
entry.description: Defines a sequence of Histograms. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Histogram Number of Bins
entry.description: The number of "bins" (entries) in the histogram. Required if a Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Histogram First Bin Value
entry.description: The stored pixel value corresponding to the lowest pixel value counted in the first bin. All image pixel values less than this value are not included in the histogram. Required if a Sequence Item is present. Note: The Value Representation of this Attribute is determined by the value of Pixel Representation (0028,0103).

entry.name: >Histogram Last Bin Value
entry.description: The stored pixel value corresponding to the highest pixel value counted in the last bin. All image pixel values greater than this value are not included in the histogram. Required if a Sequence Item is present. Note: The Value Representation of this Attribute is determined by the value of Pixel Representation (0028,0103).

entry.name: >Histogram Bin Width
entry.description: The number of consecutive stored pixel values included in a bin. All bins shall be of equal width. Required if a Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Histogram Explanation
entry.description: Free form text explanation of the meaning of the LUT.

entry.name: >Histogram Data
entry.description: Histogram Data encoded as 32 bit unsigned counts of the number of pixel values in each bin. Required if a Sequence Item is present. Page 831

entry.name: Presentation LUT Sequence
entry.description: Defines a sequence of Presentation LUTs. Only a single item shall be included in this sequence. Required if Presentation LUT Shape (2050,0020) is absent.

entry.name: >LUT Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the LUT Data in this Sequence. See C.11.6.1.1 for further explanation. Required if a Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >LUT Explanation
entry.description: Free form text explanation of the meaning of the LUT.

entry.name: >LUT Data
entry.description: LUT Data in this Sequence. Required if a Sequence Item is present.

entry.name: Presentation LUT Shape
entry.description: Specifies predefined Presentation LUT transformation. Required if Presentation LUT Sequence (2050,0010) is absent. Enumerated Values: IDENTITY - no further translation necessary, input values are P-Values INVERSE - output values after inversion are P-Values See C.11.6.1.2.

entry.name: Overlay Activation Layer
entry.description: The layer (defined in Graphic Layer (0070,0002) of the Graphic Layer Module C.10.7) in which the Overlay described in group 60xx shall be displayed. If no layer is specified (zero length) then the overlay shall not be displayed. Required if Group 60xx is present in the referenced image(s) or the Presentation State instance containing this Module.

entry.name: Softcopy VOI LUT Sequence
entry.description: Defines a sequence of VOI LUTs or Window Centers and Widths and to which images and frames they apply. No more than one VOI LUT Sequence containing a single Item or one pair of Window Center/Width values shall be specified for each image or frame. One or more Items shall be present.

include.ref: >>Include Image SOP Instance Reference Macro Table 10-3
>Include VOI LUT Macro Table C.11-2b

entry.name: >Referenced Image Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items where each Item provides reference to a selected set of Image SOP Class/SOP Instance pairs that are defined in the Presentation State Module, to which this VOI LUT or Window Center and Width applies. Required if the VOI LUT transformation in this Item does not apply to all the images listed in the Presentation State Module.

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Type of equipment that originally acquired the data. Enumerated Value: PR = Presentation State See C.7.3.1.1.1.

entry.name: Presentation Creation Date
entry.description: Date on which this presentation was created. Note: This date may be different from the date that the DICOM SOP Instance was created, since the presentation state information contained may have been recorded earlier.

include.ref: Include Content Identification Macro Table 10-12

entry.name: Presentation Creation Time
entry.description: Time at which this presentation was created. Note: This time may be different from the time that the DICOM SOP Instance was created, since the presentation state information contained may have been recorded earlier. Note: The Content Label value may be used by an application as a Defined Term in order to imply some grouping of different presentation states, i.e. it may have the same value for different presentation state instances that share some common concept. Page 837

include.ref: Include Presentation State Relationship Macro Table C.11.11-1b

entry.name: Shutter Presentation Value
entry.description: A single grayscale unsigned value used to replace those parts of the image occluded by the shutter, when rendered on a

entry.name: Mask Subtraction Sequence
entry.description: Required if Mask Module is present. Only one Item shall be present. Applicable Frame Range (0028,6102) shall not be included in the Sequence Item. See C.7.6.10 for a complete definition of the Attributes in the Items of this Sequence other than Mask Operation(0028,6101) and Applicable Frame Range (0028,6102). Notes: 1. This Sequence is replicated here in order to specify one Item, additional conditions on Mask Operation (0028,6101) and to forbid Applicable Frame Range (0028,6102). 2. The role of Applicable Frame Range (0028,6102) is replaced by Referenced Frame Number (0008,1160).

entry.name: >Mask Operation
entry.description: Type of mask operation to be performed Enumerated Values: AVG_SUB TID See C.7.6.10.1 for further explanation. Page 839 Note: The requirement in this module is for Enumerated Values which override the requirements of the Mask Module.

entry.name: >Contrast Frame Averaging
entry.description: Specified the number of contrast frames to average together before performing the mask operation. Required if Mask Frame Numbers (0028,6110) specifies more than one frame (i.e. is multi-valued). Note: The requirement in this module is conditional and overrides the optional requirements of the Mask Module.

entry.name: Recommended Viewing Mode
entry.description: Specifies the recommended viewing protocol(s). Enumerated Value: SUB = for subtraction with mask images Required if Mask Subtraction Sequence (0028,6100) is present. Note: The requirement in this module is type 1C and an Enumerated Value is specified which override the requirements of the Mask Module.

entry.name: Blending Sequence
entry.description: A Sequence of exactly two Items, one identifying and describing transformations upon a set of underlying grayscale images, and the other identifying and describing transformations upon a set of superimposed grayscale images. See C.11.14.1.1.

entry.name: >Blending Position
entry.description: Whether or not the contents of the Item represent the superimposed or underlying image set. Enumerated Values: SUPERIMPOSED UNDERLYING

include.ref: >Include Presentation State Relationship Macro Table C.11.11-1b

entry.name: >Study Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier for the Study that contains the images, which may differ from the Study in which the presentation state is contained.

entry.name: ICC Profile
entry.description: An ICC Profile encoding the transformation of device-dependent color stored pixel values into PCS-Values.

entry.name: SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the SOP Class. See C.12.1.1.1 for further explanation. See also PS 3.4.

entry.name: SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the SOP Instance. See C.12.1.1.1 for further explanation. See also PS 3.4.

entry.name: Specific Character Set
entry.description: Character Set that expands or replaces the Basic Graphic Set. Required if an expanded or replacement character set is used. See C.12.1.1.2 for Defined Terms.

entry.name: Instance Creation Date
entry.description: Date the SOP Instance was created.

entry.name: Instance Creation Time
entry.description: Time the SOP Instance was created.

entry.name: Instance Creator UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies device which created the SOP Instance.

entry.name: Related General SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies a Related General SOP Class for the SOP Class of this Instance. See PS 3.4.

entry.name: Original Specialized SOP Class UID
entry.description: The SOP Class in which the Instance was originally encoded, but which has been replaced during a fall-back conversion to the current Related General SOP Class. See PS 3.4.

entry.name: Coding Scheme Identification Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of items that map values of Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102) to an external coding system registration, or to a private or local coding scheme. One or more items may be present in the sequence.

entry.name: >Coding Scheme Designator
entry.description: The value of a Coding Scheme Designator, used in this SOP Instance, which is being mapped.

entry.name: >Coding Scheme Registry
entry.description: The name of the external registry where further definition of the identified coding scheme may be obtained. Required if coding scheme is registered. Defined term: HL7

entry.name: >Coding Scheme UID
entry.description: The coding scheme UID identifier.

entry.name: MAC Parameters Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of one or more items that describe the parameters used to calculate a MAC for use in Digital Signatures.

entry.name: >MAC ID Number
entry.description: A number used to identify this MAC Parameters Sequence item.

entry.name: >MAC Calculation Transfer Syntax UID
entry.description: The Transfer Syntax UID used to encode the values of the Data Elements included in the MAC calculation. Only Transfer Syntaxes that explicitly include the VR and use Little Endian encoding shall be used. Notes: Certain Transfer Syntaxes, particularly those that are used with compressed data, allow the fragmentation of the pixel data to change. If such fragmentation changes, Digital Signatures generated with such

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Modality type. Enumerated Value: SR = SR Document

entry.name: Series Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of the Series. Note: No SR-specific semantics are specified.

entry.name: Series Number
entry.description: A number that identifies the Series. Note: No SR-specific semantics are specified.

entry.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Performed Procedure Step Page 883 SOP Instance for which the Series is created. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence. Notes: 1. The Performed Procedure Step referred to by this Attribute is the Step during which this Document is generated. 2. If this Document is generated during the same Modality or General Purpose Performed Procedure Step as the evidence in the current interpretation procedure, this attribute may contain reference to that Modality or General Purpose Performed Procedure Step. 3. This Attribute is not used to convey reference to the evidence in the current interpretation procedure. See Current Requested Procedure Evidence Sequence (0040,A375). 4. This Sequence may be sent zero length if the Performed Procedure Step is unknown.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence (0008,1111) is sent.

entry.name: > Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence (0008,1111) is sent.

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies the SR Document.

entry.name: Completion Flag
entry.description: The estimated degree of completeness of this SR Document with respect to externally defined criteria in a manner specified in the Conformance Statement. Note: It may be desirable to make these criteria adaptable to local policies or user decisions. Enumerated Values: PARTIAL = Partial content. COMPLETE = Complete content.

entry.name: Completion Flag Description
entry.description: Explanation of the value sent in Completion Flag (0040,A491).

entry.name: Verification Flag
entry.description: Indicates whether this SR Document is Verified. Enumerated Values: UNVERIFIED = Not attested to. VERIFIED = Attested to by a Verifying Observer Name (0040,A075) who is accountable for its content. Note: The intent of this specification is that

entry.name: Study Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier for the Study

entry.name: Referenced Series Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items where each Item includes the Attributes of a Series containing referenced Composite Object(s). One or more Items may be included in this sequence

entry.name: >Series Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of a Series that is part of this Study and contains the referenced Composite Object(s).

entry.name: >Retrieve AE Title
entry.description: Title of the DICOM Application Entity where the Composite Object(s) may be retrieved on the network.

entry.name: >Storage Media File-Set ID
entry.description: The user or implementation specific human readable identifier that identifies the Storage Media on which the Composite Object (s) reside.

entry.name: >Storage Media File-Set UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Storage Media on which the Composite Object (s) reside.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Sequence
entry.description: References to Composite Object SOP Class/SOP Instance pairs that are part of the Study defined by Study Instance UID and the Series defined by Series Instance UID (0020,000E). One or more Items may be included in this sequence

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

include.ref: >>>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID may be specified in Macro

entry.name: >>Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
entry.description: Describes the purpose for which the reference is made. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence. invocation.

entry.name: >>Referenced Digital Signature Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of references to Digital Signatures in the referenced SOP Instance. Zero or more Items may be present. Note: The Attributes in this sequence can be used to detect if the referenced SOP Instance has been altered.

entry.name: >>>Digital Signature UID
entry.description: The Unique Identifier of a Digital Signature held in the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: >>>Signature
entry.description: The Signature Value identified by the Digital Signature UID within the Referenced SOP Page 889 Instance UID.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Instance MAC Sequence
entry.description: A MAC Calculation from data in the referenced SOP Instance that can be used as a data integrity check. Note: This Attribute may be used in place of the Referenced Digital Signature Sequence Attribute (0400,0402), particularly if the SOP Instance does not have appropriate Digital Signatures that can be referenced.

entry.name: >>>MAC Calculation Transfer Syntax UID
entry.description: The Transfer Syntax UID used to encode the values of the Data Elements included in the MAC calculation. When computing the MAC, only Transfer Syntaxes that explicitly include the VR and use Little Endian encoding shall be used. Notes: 1. Certain Transfer Syntaxes, particularly those that are used with compressed data, allow the fragmentation of the pixel data to change. If such fragmentation changes, Digital Signatures generated with such Transfer Syntaxes could become invalid. 2. This does not constrain the transfer syntax used to transmit the object.

entry.name: >>>MAC Algorithm
entry.description: The algorithm used in generating the MAC. Defined Terms: RIPEMD160 MD5 SHA1 Note: Digital Signature Security Profiles (see PS 3.15) may require the use of a restricted subset of these terms.

entry.name: >>>Data Elements Signed
entry.description: A list of Data Element Tags in the order they appear at the top level of the referenced SOP Instance that identify the Data Elements used in creating the MAC. See Section C.12.1.1.3.1.1.

entry.name: >>>MAC
entry.description: The MAC generated as described in Section 12.2.1.1, but unencrypted and without inclusion of fields from the Digital Signatures Sequence. See Section C.12.1.1.3.1.2.

table.name: Identified Person or Device Macro Attributes

entry.name: Observer Type
entry.description: Enumerated Values: PSN ? Person DEV ? Device

entry.name: Person Name
entry.description: Name of the person observer for this document Instance. Required if Observer Type value is PSN.

include.ref: >Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID defined

entry.name: Person Identification Code Sequence
entry.description: Coded identifier of person observer. Zero or one Items shall be permitted in this Page 891 sequence. Required if Observer Type value is PSN.

entry.name: Station Name
entry.description: Name of the device observer for this document instance. Required if Observer Type value is DEV.

entry.name: Device UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of device observer. Required if Observer Type value is DEV.

entry.name: Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of the device observer. Required if Observer Type value is DEV.

entry.name: Manufacturer's Model Name
entry.description: Model Name of the device observer. Required if Observer Type value is DEV.

entry.name: Institution Name
entry.description: Institution or organization to which the identified person is responsible or accountable, or which manages the identified device.

include.ref: >Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID defined

entry.name: Institution Code Sequence
entry.description: Institution or organization to which the identified person is responsible or accountable, or which manages the identified device. Zero or one Items shall be permitted in this Sequence.

include.ref: Include Document Content Macro Table C.17-5. with a Value Type (0040,A040) of CONTAINER
Include Document Relationship Macro Table C.17-6.

entry.name: Observation DateTime
entry.description: The date and time on which this Content Item was completed. For the purpose of recording measurements or logging events, completion time is defined as the time of data acquisition of the measurement, or the time of occurrence of the event. Required if the date and time are different from the Content Date (0008,0023) and Content Time (0008,0033) or the Observation DateTime (0040,A032) defined in higher items. May be present otherwise. Note: When Content Items are copied into successor reports, the Content Date (0008,0023) and Content Time (0008,0033) of the new report are likely to be different than the date and time of the original observation. Therefore this attribute may need to be included in any copied Content Items to satisfy the condition. Page 895

entry.name: Content Sequence
entry.description: A potentially recursively nested Sequence of Items that conveys content that is the Target of Relationships with the enclosing Source Content Item. One or more Items may be included in this sequence. Required if the enclosing Content Item has relationships. Notes: 1. If this Attribute is not present then the enclosing Item is a leaf. 2. The order of Items within this Sequence is semantically significant for presentation. See C.17.3.2.4 for further explanation.

include.ref: >Include Document Relationship Macro Table C.17-6 if the Target Content Item is included by-value in the

entry.name: >Relationship Type
entry.description: The type of relationship between the (enclosing) Source Content Item and the Target Content Item. IODs specify additional constraints on Relationships (including lists of Enumerated Values). Defined Terms: CONTAINS HAS PROPERTIES HAS OBS CONTEXT HAS ACQ CONTEXT INFERRED FROM SELECTED FROM HAS CONCEPT MOD See C.17.3.2.4 for further explanation.

table.name: KEY OBJECT DOCUMENT SERIES MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Modality type. Enumerated Value: KO = Key Object Selection

entry.name: Series Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of the Series. Note: No specific semantics are specified.

entry.name: Series Number
entry.description: A number that identifies the Series. Note: No specific semantics are specified.

entry.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance for which the Series is created. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence. Notes: See notes on this attribute in Section C.17.1 SR Document Series Module

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence (0008,1111) is sent.

entry.name: > Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence (0008,1111) is sent.

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies the Document.

entry.name: Content Date
entry.description: The date the document content creation started.

entry.name: Content Time
entry.description: The time the document content creation started.

entry.name: Referenced Request Sequence
entry.description: Identifies Requested Procedures to which this Document pertains. One or more Items may be included in this sequence. Required if this Document pertains to at

entry.name: Measured Value Sequence
entry.description: This is the value of the Content Item. Shall consist of a Sequence of Items conveying the measured value(s), which represent integers or real numbers and units of measurement. Zero or one Items shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Numeric Value
entry.description: Numeric measurement value. Only a single value shall be present.

include.ref: >>Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID is 82.

entry.name: >Measurement Units Code Sequence
entry.description: Units of measurement. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

include.ref: >Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID is 42.

entry.name: Numeric Value Qualifier Code Sequence
entry.description: Qualification of Numeric Value in Measured Value Sequence, or reason for absence of Measured Value Sequence Item. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

include.ref: >Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID is specified.

entry.name: Concept Code Sequence
entry.description: This is the value of the Content Item. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: Referenced SOP Sequence
entry.description: References to Composite Object SOP Class/SOP Instance pairs. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

include.ref: Include 'Composite Object Reference Macro' Table C.18.3-1

entry.name: >Referenced Frame Number
entry.description: Identifies the frame numbers within the Referenced SOP Instance to which the reference applies. The first frame shall be denoted as frame number 1. Note: This Attribute may be multi-valued. Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a multi-frame image and the reference does not apply to all frames, and Referenced Segment Number (0062,000B) is not present.

entry.name: >Referenced Segment Number
entry.description: Identifies the segments to which the reference applies identified by Segment Number (0062,0004). Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a Segmentation and the reference does not apply to all segments and Referenced Frame Number (0008,1160) is not present.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Sequence
entry.description: Reference to a Softcopy Presentation State SOP Class/SOP Instance pair. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: >Referenced Real World Value Mapping Instance Sequence
entry.description: Reference to a Real World Value Mapping SOP Page 909 Class/SOP Instance pair. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >>Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

include.ref: >> Include `Image Pixel Macro' Table C.7-11b See Section F.7.

entry.name: >Icon Image Sequence
entry.description: This Icon Image is representative of the Image. The Icon Image may be no greater than 128 rows by 128 columns.

include.ref: Include 'Composite Object Reference Macro' Table C.18.3-1

entry.name: >Referenced Waveform Channels
entry.description: List of channels in Waveform to which the reference applies. See C.18.5.1.1 Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a Waveform that contains multiple Channels and not all Channels in the Waveform are referenced.

entry.name: Graphic Data
entry.description: An ordered set of (column,row) pairs that denote positions in an image specified with sub-pixel resolution such that the origin at the TLHC of the TLHC pixel is 0.0\0.0, the BRHC of the TLHC pixel is 1.0\1.0, and the BRHC of the BRHC pixel is Columns\Rows. The values must be within the range 0\0 to Columns\Rows. The values Columns (0028,0011) and Rows (0028,0010) are those contained in the referenced image. See C.18.6.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Graphic Type
entry.description: See C.18.6.1.2 for Enumerated Values.

entry.name: Temporal Range Type
entry.description: See C.18.7.1.1 for Enumerated Values.

entry.name: Referenced Sample Positions
entry.description: List of samples within a multiplex group specifying temporal points of the referenced data. Position of first sample is 1. Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a Waveform and Referenced Time Offsets (0040,A138) and Referenced Datetime (0040,A13A) are not present. May be used only if Referenced Channels (0040,A0B0) refers to channels within a single multiplex group.

entry.name: Referenced Time Offsets
entry.description: Specifies temporal points for reference by number of seconds after start of data. Required if Referenced Sample Positions (0040,A132) and Referenced Datetime (0040,A13A) are not present.

entry.name: Referenced Datetime
entry.description: Specifies temporal points for reference by absolute time. Required if Referenced Sample Positions (0040,A132) and Referenced Time Offsets (0040,A138) are not present.

entry.name: Continuity of Content
entry.description: This flag specifies for a CONTAINER whether or not its contained Content Items are logically linked in a continuous textual flow, or are separate items. Enumerated Values: SEPARATE CONTINUOUS See C.18.8.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Content Template Sequence
entry.description: Template that describes the content of this Content Item and its subsidiary Content Items. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence. Required if a template was used to define the content of this Item, and the template consists of a single CONTAINER with nested content, and it is the outermost invocation of a set of nested templates that start with the same CONTAINER (see C.18.8.1.2).

entry.name: >Mapping Resource
entry.description: Mapping Resource that defines the template. See Section 8.4. Defined Terms: DCMR = DICOM Content Mapping Resource

entry.name: >Template Identifier
entry.description: Template identifier.

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this image. The value shall be unique within a series.

entry.name: Content Date
entry.description: The date the raw data creation was started.

entry.name: Content Time
entry.description: The time the raw data creation was started.

entry.name: Acquisition Datetime
entry.description: The date and time that the acquisition of data started. Note: The synchronization of this time with an external clock is specified in the synchronization Module in Acquisition Time synchronized (0018,1800).

entry.name: Creator-Version UID
entry.description: Unique identification of the equipment and version of the software that has created the Raw Data information. The UID allows one to avoid attempting to interpret raw data with an unknown format.

include.ref: >Include `Image SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table 10-3

entry.name: Referenced Instance Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that provides reference to a set of SOP Class/Instance pairs identifying other Instances significantly related to this Instance. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1

entry.name: >Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
entry.description: Describes the purpose for which the reference is made. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence. See C.7.6.16.2.5.1. No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Modality type. Enumerated Value: REG

entry.name: Content Date
entry.description: The date the content creation started.
